o

o 1.1

letter. (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel
Sanskrit o

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
o 1.2

letter. (gram) vuddhi form of the letters u and ū ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) vuddhi form of the letters u and ū
Sanskrit o

Examples

513, 435. o ava sare.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 513

te o e'icc'ete āva āy'ādese pāpuṇanti kārite. lāveti, nāyeti. yogavibhāgena aññasmim'pi ekārassa āy'ādeso hoti. gāyati, gāyanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 515
o 2.1

cs. (gram) o; conjugational sign of group 7 tanādigaṇa verbs ✓

Grammar cs, masc
Meaning (gram) o; conjugational sign of group 7 tanādigaṇa verbs
Sanskrit o

Examples

451, 520. tanādito o yirā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 451

tanu'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato o yira'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. tanoti, tanohi, karoti, karohi, kayirati, kayirāhi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 451
o 3.1

prefix. down [ava] ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning down
Construction ava > o
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym ava, ni
Sanskrit ava

Examples

āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde yojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, dviyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, tiyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
oka 1.1

masc. home; abode [√uc + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning home; abode
Root Family √uc
Root √uc×3 ya (comfort)
Construction √uc > ok + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
c > k
Antonym anoka
Synonym āsaya
Sanskrit oka, okas
Sanskrit Root √uc 4 (be pleased)

Examples

okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī,
gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno,
kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

rūpadhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko. rūpadhāturāgavinibandhañ'ca pana viññāṇaṃ, okasārī'ti vuccati.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ
oka 2.1

nt. water [√ud + aka] ✓

Grammar nt, abbrev of udaka
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud + aka
udaka > oka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ambu, uda, udaka, oda, odaka, ka, jala, toya, daka, ninnaga, vāri, salila
Sanskrit udaka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Example

vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.

DHP 34 cittavaggo
okacara

masc. tame animal; domesticated animal; lit. wandering in the home [oka + cara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning tame animal; domesticated animal; lit. wandering in the home
Construction oka + cara
Compound sattamī tappurisa (oke + cara)
Commentary (MNa) odaheyya okacaran'ti tesaṃ oke caramānaṃ viya ekaṃ dīpakamigaṃ ekasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhapeyya.
Sanskrit okaḥsārin

Example

so yv'āssa maggo khemo sovatthiko pītigamanīyo taṃ maggaṃ pidaheyya, vivareyya kummaggaṃ, odaheyya okacaraṃ, ṭhapeyya okacārikaṃ.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
okacārikā

fem. tame female animal; domesticated female animal; lit. wandering in the home [oka + cara + *ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp, from okacara
Meaning tame female animal; domesticated female animal; lit. wandering in the home
Construction oka + cara > cāra + *ikā
okacara + ikā
Derivative taddhita (*ikā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) okacārikan'ti dīgharajjuyā bandhitaṃ'y'eva migiṃ.
Sanskrit okaḥsārin +

Example

iti kho, bhikkhave, vivaṭo mayā khemo maggo sovatthiko pītigamanīyo, pihito kummaggo, ūhato okacaro, nāsitā okacārikā. yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
okañjaha

adj. leaving home, abandoning a house; without resort ✗
okaḍḍhati

pr. drags away, drags off [ava + √kaḍḍh] ✗
okantati

pr. (+acc) cuts off; carves off; saws off [ava + √kat + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning cuts off; carves off; saws off
Root Family ava √kat
Root √kat･2 ṃa (cut)
Base √kat + ṃa > kanta
Construction ava + kanta + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakṛt
Sanskrit Root √kṛt 1, 6 (cut)

Examples

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
okapuṇṇa

adj. soaked with water ✗
okappana

nt. believing; having conviction; having confidence [ava + √kapp] ✗
okappaniya

ptp. (+dat) could be possible (for); believable; likely (for); (comm) is trustworthy (for); lit. to be thought down [ava + √kapp + aniya] ✓

Grammar ptp of okappeti (+dat)
Meaning could be possible (for); believable; likely (for); (comm) is trustworthy (for); lit. to be thought down
Root Family ava √kapp
Root √kapp･8 *e (think)
Construction ava + √kapp + aniya
Derivative kicca (aniya)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (MNa) okappaniyam'etan'ti saddahaniyam'etaṃ.
Sanskrit avakalpanīya
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

Example

okappaniyam'etaṃ bhoto gotamassa yathā taṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
okappanīya

ptp. to believe; to trust [ava + √kapp] ✗
okappeti

pr. (+loc) suspects (of); has a hunch (about); considers possible; lit. think down [ava + √kapp + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning suspects (of); has a hunch (about); considers possible; lit. think down
Root Family ava √kapp
Root √kapp･8 *e (think)
Base √kapp + e > kappe
Construction ava + kappe + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakalpayati
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

Example

yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ, so tañ'ca anāsanaṃ tañ'ca agocaraṃ te ca pāpake mitte paṭisaṅkhā yoniso parivajjeti

MN 2.6 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
okappenta

prp. (+loc) believing (in); having conviction (in); having confidence (in); lit. thinking down [ava + √kapp + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of okappeti, intrans (+loc)
Meaning believing (in); having conviction (in); having confidence (in); lit. thinking down
Root Family ava √kapp
Root √kapp･8 *e (think)
Base √kapp + e > kappe
Construction ava + kappe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakalpayat
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)
okamoka

masc. all homes; lit. home after home [okaṃ + oka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from oka
Meaning all homes; lit. home after home
Construction okaṃ + oka
Compound dvanda (okaṃ ca oka ca)
Commentary (DHPa) okam'okan'ti ālay'ālayaṃ, sabb'ālaye pariccajantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit oka + oka

Example

uyyuñjanti satīmanto,
na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā'va pallalaṃ hitvā,
okam'okaṃ jahanti te.

DHP 91 arahantavaggo
okamokata

sandhi. from (its) home in the water; lit. from water home [okaṃ + okata] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + nt
Meaning from (its) home in the water; lit. from water home
Construction okaṃ + okata
Notes Sanskrit Udānavarga 31 (Cittavarga) has okād oghāt, which is abl sg of oka + ogha "from home from stream". Pāli equivalent would be okamoghato.
Sanskrit udaka + oka

Example

vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.

DHP 34 cittavaggo
okamokato

ind. from its home, water; from a watery home ✗
okampetvā

abs. (+acc) (of head) having shaken [ava + √kamp + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of okampeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of head) having shaken
Root Family ava √kamp
Root √kamp･1 *e (shake, tremble)
Base √kamp + e > kampe (caus)
Construction ava + kampe + tvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit ava + kamp
Sanskrit Root √kamp 1 (tremble)

Examples

evaṃ vutte daṇḍapāṇi sakko sīsaṃ okampetvā, jivhaṃ nillāḷetvā, tivisākhaṃ nalāṭikaṃ nalāṭe vuṭṭhāpetvā daṇḍam'olubbha pakkāmi.

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako hupeyya'p'āvuso'ti vatvā sīsaṃ okampetvā ummaggaṃ gahetvā pakkāmi.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
okaya

masc. renting; hiring; lit. buying down [ava + √kī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from okiṇāti
Meaning renting; hiring; lit. buying down
Root Family ava √kī
Root √kī･5 nā (buy)
√ In Comps kkī
Construction ava + √kī > kay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Variant ākaya, kaya
Sanskrit avakraya
Sanskrit Root √krī 9 (buy)

Example

na hi tattha kasi atthi,
gorakkhettha na vijjati,
vaṇijjā t'ādisī n'atthi,
hiraññena kay'okayaṃ,
ito dinnena yāpenti,
petā kālaṅ'katā tahiṃ.

KHP7 tirokuṭṭasuttaṃ
okasārī

adj. settled in a home; lit. roaming within an abode [oka + sārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning settled in a home; lit. roaming within an abode
Construction oka + sārī
Compound kammadhāraya (oka + sārī)
Antonym anokasārī
Synonym niketasārī
Sanskrit oka + sārin

Example

rūpadhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko. rūpadhāturāgavinibandhañ'ca pana viññāṇaṃ, okasārī'ti vuccati.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ
okassa

ind. dragging down or away; roughly, forcibly ✗
okāra 1.1

masc. (+gen) inferiority (of); baseness (of); lit. making down [ava + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc (+gen)
Meaning inferiority (of); baseness (of); lit. making down
Root Family ava √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ava + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) okāran'ti lāmakaṃ, khandhesu vā otāraṃ.
Notes BHS suggests "elimination"
Sanskrit avakāra (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, addasaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ vodānapakkhaṃ.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā brahmāyussa brāhmaṇassa anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyath'idaṃ, dānakathaṃ, sīlakathaṃ, saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
okāra 2.1

masc. (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel [o + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel
Construction o + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (o + kāra)
Synonym otta
Sanskrit okāra

Example

511, 521. uttam'okāro.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 511
okāra 2.2

masc. (gram) vuddhi form of the letters u and ū [o + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) vuddhi form of the letters u and ū
Construction o + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (o + kāra)
Sanskrit okāra

Example

okārassa dhātv'antassa sare pare av'ādeso hoti. cavati. bhavati. o'ti kim'atthaṃ? jayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 513
okāranta

adj. (gram) ending with the letter o [o + kāra + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) ending with the letter o
Construction o + kāra + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (okāra + anta)
Synonym odanta
Sanskrit o + kāra + anta

Example

tattha akkharesu okār'antā aṭṭha sarā nāma.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
okārapaccaya

cs. (gram) o suffix; conjugational sign of group 7 tanādigaṇa verbs [o + kāra + paccaya] ✓

Grammar cs, masc, comp
Meaning (gram) o suffix; conjugational sign of group 7 tanādigaṇa verbs
Construction o + kāra + paccaya
Compound kammadhāraya (okāra + paccaya)
Sanskrit okāra + pratyaya

Example

okārapaccayo uttam'āpajjate vā. kurute, karoti. okāro'ti kim'atthaṃ? hoti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 511
okāsa 1

masc. space; open space; opening; (comm) meditation [ava + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from okāsati
Meaning space; open space; opening; (comm) meditation
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ava + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (SNa) okāsan'ti jhānass'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit avakāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yāvañ'c'idaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okās'ādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ

sambādhe vata okāsaṃ,
avindi bhūrimedhaso,
yo jhānam'abujjhi buddho,
paṭilīnanisabho munī'ti.

SN 2.7 pañcālacaṇḍasuttaṃ
okāsa 2

masc. opportunity; chance [ava + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from okāsati
Meaning opportunity; chance
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ava + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym avakāsa, otāra, vāra
Sanskrit avakāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

mārā labhantu n'okāsaṃ kātuñ'ca viriyesu me.

Trad

okāsa 3

masc. permission; consent [ava + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from okāsati
Meaning permission; consent
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ava + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Examples

adaṃsu te mam'okāsaṃ,
sodhetuṃ añjasaṃ tadā,
buddho buddho'ti cintento,
maggaṃ sodhem'ahaṃ tadā.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā

sappi'ādīni bhesajjāni aṭṭhavidhāni pānakāni vatthacchādanamālāgandh'ādīni vā ādāya vihāraṃ gantvā tāni datvā divāṭṭhānaṃ pavisitvā okāsaṃ kāretvā pañhaṃ pucchati. evañ'hi vattaṃ ñatvā pucchanto paṭipadāya saṇṭhāti nāma.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
okāsa 4

ind. permit me!; excuse me!; with your permission! [ava + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar ind, excl, from okāsati
Meaning permit me!; excuse me!; with your permission!
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ava + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Example

okāsa! sammajjanī: sammajjanakaraṇaṃ kataṃ kiṃ?

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi
okāsa 5

masc. (gram) locative case [ava + √kās] ✗
okāsakata

adj. given permission; allowed; lit. made space [okāsa + kata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning given permission; allowed; lit. made space
Construction okāsa + kata
Antonym anokāsakata
Commentary (VVt) okāso kato yena so okāsakato
okāsakamma

nt. permission; consent; leave; lit. making space [okāsa + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning permission; consent; leave; lit. making space
Construction okāsa + kamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (okāsaṃ + kamma)
Sanskrit avakāśa + karman

Example

yaṃ vat'āhaṃ aññesu samaṇabrāhmaṇesu okāsakammamattam'pi n'ālatthaṃ taṃ me idaṃ samaṇena gotamena okāsakammaṃ katan'ti. attamano pamudito udaggo pītisomanassajāto bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
okāsakammaṃ kataṃ

idiom. (+instr) granted permission (by); allowed (by); lit. made making space ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pp (+instr)
Meaning granted permission (by); allowed (by); lit. made making space
Sanskrit avakāśa + karman + kṛta

Example

yaṃ vat'āhaṃ aññesu samaṇabrāhmaṇesu okāsakammamattam'pi n'ālatthaṃ taṃ me idaṃ samaṇena gotamena okāsakammaṃ katan'ti. attamano pamudito udaggo pītisomanassajāto bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
okāsapharaṇa

adj. taking up space; filling up room; lit. pervading space [okāsa + pharaṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking up space; filling up room; lit. pervading space
Construction okāsa + pharaṇa
Commentary (ANa) okāsapharaṇo'ti okāsaṃ pharitvā aññesaṃ sambādhaṃ katvā ṭhānena okāsapharaṇo.
okāsamakāsi

aor. (+dat) made space (for); made room (for); gave way (to) [okāsaṃ + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor of okāsaṃ karoti, comp vb (+dat)
Meaning made space (for); made room (for); gave way (to)
Construction okāsaṃ + akāsi
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Commentary (MNa) oramiya okāsamakāsī'ti vegena uṭṭhāya dvidhā bhijjitvā okāsam'akāsi.
Sanskrit avakāśa + kṛ

Example

disvāna oramiya okāsam'akāsi yathā taṃ ñātassa yasassino.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
okāsasabbhāva

masc. (+dat) existence of occasion (to); presence of opportunity (to) [okāsa + sabbhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp (+dat)
Meaning existence of occasion (to); presence of opportunity (to)
Construction okāsa + sabbhāva
Antonym okāsābhāva
okāsasenāsana

nt. living space; lit. space bed and chair [okāsa + senāsana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning living space; lit. space bed and chair
Construction okāsa + senāsana
okāsaṃ karoti

idiom. (+dat) grants permission (to); gives an opportunity (to); gives consent (to); lit. makes space [okāsaṃ + karoti] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr (+dat)
Meaning grants permission (to); gives an opportunity (to); gives consent (to); lit. makes space
Construction okāsaṃ + karoti
Sanskrit avakāśa + karoti

Examples

puccheyyāma mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ kañci'd'eva desaṃ, sace āyasmā channo okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā'ti. pucch'āvuso sāriputta, sutvā vedissāmā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, puccheyy'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ kiñci'd'eva desaṃ, sace me bhavaṃ gotamo okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā'ti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
okāsaṃ kārāpeti

idiom. causes to give an opportunity; obtains consent; gains permission (especially to speak) ✗
okāsaṃ kāreti

idiom. causes to give an opportunity; obtains consent; gains permission (especially to speak) ✗
okāsaṃ kāretvā

idiom. (+dat) having gained permission (to); having been given consent (to); lit. having caused to make space [okāsaṃ + kāretvā] ~

Grammar idiom, masc + abs (+dat)
Meaning having gained permission (to); having been given consent (to); lit. having caused to make space
Construction okāsaṃ + kāretvā
Sanskrit avakāśa + krayitvā
okāsaṃ yācati

idiom. (+dat) asks for the opportunity (to); requests permission (to) ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr (+dat)
Meaning asks for the opportunity (to); requests permission (to)
Sanskrit avakāśam + yācati

Example

añña'd'atthu samaṇaṃ'y'eva gotamaṃ okāsaṃ yācanti agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjāya.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
okāsādhigama

masc. finding of space; discovery of room; lit. reaching of space [okāsa + adhigama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning finding of space; discovery of room; lit. reaching of space
Construction okāsa + adhigama
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (okāsassa + adhigama)
Commentary (ANa) okāsādhigamo'ti okāsassa adhigamo.
Sanskrit avakāśa + adhigama

Example

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yāvañ'c'idaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okās'ādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ
okāsābhāva

masc. (+dat) absence of occasion (to); lack of opportunity (to) [okāsa + abhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp (+dat)
Meaning absence of occasion (to); lack of opportunity (to)
Construction okāsa + abhāva
Antonym okāsasabbhāva
okāseti

pr. (+acc) places in the open; makes visible; (comm) scatters around; lit. causes to be visible [ava + √kās + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ava √kās, trans (+acc)
Meaning places in the open; makes visible; (comm) scatters around; lit. causes to be visible
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 *e (shine, be visible)
Base √kās + e > kāse (caus)
Construction ava + kāse + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (SNa) okāsesī'ti vippakiri.
Sanskrit avakāśayati
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Example

sādhu me, bhante, ayyo mahako uttarimanussadhammaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ dassetū'ti. tena hi tvaṃ, gahapati, ālinde uttarāsaṅgaṃ paññapetvā tiṇakalāpaṃ okāsehī'ti.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
okāsesi

aor. (+acc) placed in the open; made visible; (comm) scattered around; lit. caused to be visible [ava + √kās + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of okāseti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning placed in the open; made visible; (comm) scattered around; lit. caused to be visible
Root Family ava √kās
Root √kās･1 *e (shine, be visible)
Base √kās + e > kāse (caus)
Construction ava + kāse + si
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avakāś
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

Example

evaṃ, bhante'ti kho citto gahapati āyasmato mahakassa paṭissutvā ālinde uttarāsaṅgaṃ paññapetvā tiṇakalāpaṃ okāsesi.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ

Meaning covered (with); splattered (by); sprinkled (with); lit. sprinkled down
Root Family ava √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Construction ava + √kir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ava > o
rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit avakīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

Example

vātavuṭṭhisamayo nāma bhikkhū sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti, dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni kāye patitāni honti, vātavuṭṭhisamayo'ti nahāyitabbaṃ.

Examples

sabbaphāliphullā kho, ānanda, yamakasālā akālapupphehi. te tathāgatassa sarīraṃ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

so tattha sukkhāni c'eva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni gomayāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, mukhavātañ'ca dadeyya, na ca paṃsukena okireyya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
okiranta

Example

tassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ sodhāpetvā pākāraparikkhepaṃ kārāpetvā vālukaṃ okirāpetvā dhajapaṭākaṃ ussāpetvā vanappatiṃ alaṅ'karitvā añjaliṃ karitvā, sace puttaṃ vā dhītaraṃ vā labheyyaṃ, tumhākaṃ mahāsakkāraṃ karissāmī'ti patthanaṃ katvā pakkāmi.

okkaṭṭha

pp. pulled down; lit. dragged down [ati + ava + √kas + ta] ~

Grammar pp of
Meaning pulled down; lit. dragged down
Root Family ava √kas
Root √kas･1 a (drag, draw)
Construction ati > aty > acc + ava + √kas + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
st > ṭṭh
Antonym ukkaṭṭha
Commentary (MNa) yo yāva gopphakā otāretvāva pārupati, tassa accukkaṭṭhaṃ hoti ... yo ek'aṃsaṃ katvā thanaṃ vivaritvā yāti, tassa'pi accukkaṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit ati + avakṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
okkanta

pp. (+acc or +instr) entered; gone (into); lit. gone down [ava + √kam + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of okkamati (+acc or +instr)
Meaning entered; gone (into); lit. gone down
Root Family ava √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction ava + √kam + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
m > n
Synonym anupaviṭṭha, paviṭṭha
Commentary (SNa) okkanto sammattaniyāman'ti paviṭṭho ariyamaggaṃ.
Sanskrit avakram
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

tatra vata maṃ bhayaṃ vā sārajjaṃ vā okkamissatī'ti nimittam'etaṃ, sāriputta, na samanupassāmi. etam'ahaṃ, sāriputta, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.

idh'āvuso satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekaṃ n'ānusikkhanti, yesañ'ca dhammānaṃ satthā pahānam'āha, te ca dhamme nappajahanti, bāhulikā ca honti, sāthalikā, okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā

okkamaniya

gāmaṃ paviseyyā'ti parikkhittassa gāmassa parikkhepaṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa. aparikkhittassa gāmassa upacāraṃ okkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.

Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma yena rukkhamūlaṃ ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
okkalā

masc. (also ukkalā) the inhabitants of the country Ukkala (modern day Orissa) ✗
okkassa

ind. dragging down or away; roughly, forcibly [ava + √kass] ✗
okkassayati

pr. draws down or out [ava + √kass] ✗
okkāka

masc. name of a king ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a king
Sanskrit ikṣvāku

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, ambaṭṭha, rājā okkāko yā sā mahesī piyā manāpā, tassā puttassa rajjaṃ pariṇāmetu'kāmo jeṭṭhakumāre raṭṭhasmā pabbājesi, okkāmukhaṃ karakaṇḍaṃ hatthinikaṃ sinisūraṃ.

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
okkācita

nt. boasting; bragging; empty talk; lit. talked up [ud + √kac + *e + ita + *a] ~

Meaning boasting; bragging; empty talk; lit. talked up
Root Family ud √kac
Root √kac･8 *e (shine, bind)
Base √kac + *e > kāce
Construction ud > od + kāce + ita + *a
ukkācita + *a

Phonetic Change u > o
a > ā
d > k
Synonym ullapana
Variant ukkācita
Commentary (ANa) okkācitavinītā'ti dubbinītā.
Sanskrit Root √kac √kañc 1 (shine, bind)

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
okkāmeti

pr. (+acc) causes to enter; lit. causes to go down [ava + √kam + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of okkamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to enter; lit. causes to go down
Root Family ava √kam
Root √kam･1 *e (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Base √kam + *e > kāme (caus)
Construction ava + kāme + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Sanskrit avakramayati
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Example

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

pr. descends into [ava + √khand] ✗

fem. large pot; cauldron ✓

Meaning large pot; cauldron
Variant ukkha
Commentary (SNa) okkhāsatan'ti mahāmukhaukkhalīnaṃ sataṃ.
Sanskrit ukhā

Example

yo, bhikkhave, pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ okkhāsataṃ dānaṃ dadeyya, yo majjh'anhikasamayaṃ okkhāsataṃ dānaṃ dadeyya, yo sāy'anhasamayaṃ okkhāsataṃ dānaṃ dadeyya

SN 20.4 okkhāsuttaṃ
okkhāyati

pr. is seen or known, is visible, appears [ava + √khā] ✗
okkhāyika

adj. sunk deeply; deeply receded; lit. exhausted down [ava + √khī + *a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from okkhaya
Meaning sunk deeply; deeply receded; lit. exhausted down
Root Family ava √khī
Root √khī･1 a (exhaust, destroy)
√ In Comps khī or kkhī
Construction ava + √khī > khay + *a + ika
okkhaya + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change ava > o
ī > ay
Commentary (MNa) okkhāyikā'ti heṭṭhā anupaviṭṭhā. tassa kira lohite chinne maṃse milāte akkhiāvāṭakā matthaluṅgaṃ āhacca aṭṭhaṃsu, ten'assa evarūpā akkhitārakā ahesuṃ.
Notes CPD also suggests from ava √khā
Sanskrit avakṣaya, avakṣīṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṣi 1, 5, 9 (destroy)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma gambhīre udapāne udakatārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti, evam'ev'assu me akkhikūpesu akkhitārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 20.4 (SN20.4) ✗

Grammar pp of okkhipati

Root √khip･1 a (throw)

Construction ava + √khip + ta

p > t

Examples

jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

okkhittacakkhu antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

ogadha 1

pp. (+loc) immersed (in); absorbed (in); plunged (into) [ava + √gāh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ogāhati, in comps (+loc)
Meaning immersed (in); absorbed (in); plunged (into)
Root Family ava √gāh
Root √gāh･1 a (dive, plunge)
√ In Comps gāh or ggāh
Construction ava + √gāh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym ajjhogāḷha, ogādha, pagāḷha
Sanskrit avagāḍha
Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

Examples

accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ. nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, brahmacariyaṃ vussati nibbānaparāyaṇaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

vedanāsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā, samādhippamukhā sabbe dhammā, sat'ādhipateyyā sabbe dhammā, paññ'uttarā sabbe dhammā, vimuttisārā sabbe dhammā, amat'ogadhā sabbe dhammā, nibbānapariyosānā sabbe dhammā'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
ogadha 2

pp. (+loc) grounded upon [ava + √gāh] ✗
ogamana 1

nt. going down [ava + √gam] ✗
ogamana 2

nt. (of the sun, a star or a planet) setting [ava + √gam] ✗
ogayha

ger. lunging or absorbing [ava + √gāh] ✗
ogahaṇa

nt. bathing place; bathing ford; lit. plunging down [ava + √gāh + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ogāhati
Meaning bathing place; bathing ford; lit. plunging down
Root Family ava √gāh
Root √gāh･1 a (dive, plunge)
√ In Comps gāh or ggāh
Construction ava + √gāh + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Commentary (SNPa) evam'evaṃ yo ogahaṇe thambho'r'iv'ābhijāyati yasmiṃ pare vācāpariyantaṃ vadanti. kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? yasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ pare titthiyā vā aññe vā vaṇṇavasena uparimaṃ vā avaṇṇavasena heṭṭhimaṃ vā vācāpariyantaṃ vadanti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ anunayaṃ vā paṭighaṃ vā anāpajjamāno tādibhāvena yo ogahaṇe thambho'r'iva bhavatī'ti.
Sanskrit avagāhana
Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

Example

yo ogahaṇe thambho'r'iv'ābhijāyati,
yasmiṃ pare vācāpariyantaṃ vadanti,
taṃ vītarāgaṃ susamāhit'indriyaṃ,
taṃ vā'pi dhīrā muni vedayanti.

Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

Example

abhigajjant'iva mālut'eritā,

yadi ekā vanam'ogahissasi.

VIN 2.5.3.2 atthaṅgatasikkhāpadaṃ
oggamana

Examples

nāvaṃ sitvā'va pāragū'ti.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
ogha 2

masc. (of defilements) deluge; inundation; torrent ✓

Grammar masc, in comps
Meaning (of defilements) deluge; inundation; torrent
Notes (PDB) forces whose pull is so strong that, like a flood or strong current, they overwhelm the hapless ordinary person
Sanskrit ogha, augha

Examples

mahā udakaṇṇavo'ti kho, bhikkhave, catunn'etaṃ oghānaṃ adhivacanaṃ kām'oghassa, bhav'oghassa, diṭṭh'oghassa, avijj'oghassa.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ

satthā ca me lokam'imaṃ adhiṭṭhahi,
aniccato addhuvato asārato,
pakkhanda maṃ citta jinassa sāsane,
tārehi oghā mahatā suduttarā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
oghatama

nt. darkness of the floods ✗
oghatamas

masc. deluge of darkness; flood of ignorance [ogha + tamas] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, mano group
Meaning deluge of darkness; flood of ignorance
Construction ogha + tamas
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ogha + tamaso)
Variant oghantam
Commentary (SNPa) oghatamagā oghatamaṃ ogh'andhakāraṃ agā atikkanto. ogh'antam'agā'ti'pi pāṭho, oghānaṃ antaṃ agā
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit ogha + tamas

Example

yāni ca tīṇi yāni ca saṭṭhi,
samaṇappavādasitāni bhūripañña,
saññ'akkharasaññanissitāni,
osaraṇāni vineyya oghatam'agā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
oghatara

adj. who has crossed the flood; crossing the torrent ✗
oghataraṇasutta

nt. Discourse on Crossing the Flood; Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.1 (SN1.1) ✗
oghatiṇṇa

adj. who has crossed over the flood; who has overcome the deluge [ogha + tiṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has crossed over the flood; who has overcome the deluge
Construction ogha + tiṇṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (oghaṃ + tiṇṇa)
Commentary (THa) kām'ogho, bhav'ogho, diṭṭh'ogho, avijj'ogho'ti catunnaṃ oghānaṃ tiṇṇattā oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit ogha + tīrṇa

Examples

pañca chinde pañca jahe,
pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañcasaṅg'ātigo bhikkhu,
oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā

okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ,
nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ,
kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ,
sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
oghana

nt. weighing down, pulling down; downward force; lit. grasping down [ava + √gah + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act
Meaning weighing down, pulling down; downward force; lit. grasping down
Root Family ava √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction ava + √gah + ana
ogahana > oghana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change gah > gh (contraction)
Commentary (MNa) oghanaṃ janeyyā'ti heṭṭhā ghanaṃ janeyya. upari āruyha sakalaṃ rukkhaṃ paliveṭhetvā puna heṭṭhā bhassamānā bhūmiṃ gaṇheyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit avagrahaṇa
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

Example

sā taṃ sālaṃ anuparihareyya. sā taṃ sālaṃ anupariharitvā upari viṭabhiṃ kareyya. upari viṭabhiṃ karitvā oghanaṃ janeyya. oghanaṃ janetvā ye tassa sālassa mahantā mahantā khandhā te padāleyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
oghapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.11 (SN38.11) ✗
oghamatari

aor. crossed the flood; made it across the deluge [oghaṃ + atari] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning crossed the flood; made it across the deluge
Construction oghaṃ + atari
Compound comp verb (oghaṃ + atari)
Commentary (SNa) ogham'atarī'ti ettha cattāro oghā, kām'ogho bhav'ogho diṭṭh'ogho avijj'ogho'ti.
Sanskrit ogham + atāri

Example

kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti? appatiṭṭhaṃ khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, anāyūhaṃ ogham'atarin'ti.

oghavagga 1

masc. Chapter 10 of the Balasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

oghasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.172 (SN45.172) ✗
oghātiga

adj. going beyond or crossing the floods ✗
oghādisutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.121-128 (SN46.121-128) ✗
oghādisutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 53.13-22 (SN53.13-22) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 48.83-92 (SN48.83-92) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 48.105-114 (SN48.105-114) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 3

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 49.36-45 (SN49.36-45) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 4

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 50.14-23 (SN50.14-23) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 5

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 50.48-57 (SN50.48-57) ✗
oghādisuttadasaka 6

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 51.45-54 (SN51.45-54) ✗
ocaraka 1

adj. lowlife; mean; rough; lit. going down [ava + √car + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ocarati
Meaning lowlife; mean; rough; lit. going down
Root Family ava √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ava + √car + a + ka
ocara + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (MNa) ocarakā'ti avacarakā heṭṭhācarakā, nīcakammakārakā'ti attho
Sanskrit avacaraka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
ocaraka 2

masc. undercover agent; informant; spy; infiltrator; lit. going down [ava + √car + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ocarati
Meaning undercover agent; informant; spy; infiltrator; lit. going down
Root Family ava √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ava + √car + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym sūcaka
Commentary (SNa) ocarakā'ti heṭṭhācarakā.
Sanskrit avacaraka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ete, bhante, mama purisā carā ocarakā janapadaṃ ocaritvā āgacchanti. tehi paṭhamaṃ ociṇṇaṃ ahaṃ pacchā osāpayissāmi.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
ocarati

pr. (+loc) comes down (in); is handed down (in); lit. goes down [ava + √car + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning comes down (in); is handed down (in); lit. goes down
Root Family ava √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Base √car + a > cara
Construction ava + cara + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (MNa) evañ'hi no sutte ocaratī'ti yasmā amhākaṃ sutte evaṃ āgacchati, na mayaṃ mukh'āruḷh'icchāmattaṃ vadāma, sutte ca nāma āgataṃ vadamānā kassa bhāyeyyāma, tasmā sammukhā'pi naṃ vadeyyāmā'ti attho.
Sanskrit avacarati
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

sammukhā ce'pi mayaṃ, bho bhāradvāja, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ passeyyāma, sammukhā'pi naṃ vadeyyāma, bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? evañ'hi no sutte ocaratī'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ocaritvā

abs. (+acc) having gone undercover; having reconnoitred; having scouted; having infiltrated; (comm) having learned what happened; lit. having gone down [ava + √car + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ocarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having gone undercover; having reconnoitred; having scouted; having infiltrated; (comm) having learned what happened; lit. having gone down
Root Family ava √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ava + √car + itvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (SNa) ocaritvā'ti avacaritvā vīmaṃsitvā, taṃ taṃ pavattiṃ ñatvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit avacarati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ete, bhante, mama purisā carā ocarakā janapadaṃ ocaritvā āgacchanti. tehi paṭhamaṃ ociṇṇaṃ ahaṃ pacchā osāpayissāmi.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
ociṇṇa 1.1

pp. gone undercover; reconnoitred; scouted; investigated; infiltrated; lit. gone down [ava + √car + ina] ✓

Grammar pp of ocarati
Meaning gone undercover; reconnoitred; scouted; investigated; infiltrated; lit. gone down
Root Family ava √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ava + √car > cir + ina
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avacīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

Example

ete, bhante, mama purisā carā ocarakā janapadaṃ ocaritvā āgacchanti. tehi paṭhamaṃ ociṇṇaṃ ahaṃ pacchā osāpayissāmi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāressantī'ti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
ociṇṇa 2.1

pp. gathered, collected, or plucked [ava + √ci] ✗
ocita

pp. gathered, collected, or plucked [ava + √ci] ✗
ocinati

pr. gathers, picks; collects; accumulates; increases, strengthens [ava + √ci] ✗
ocinana

nt. gathering, picking [ava + √ci] ✗
ocinanta

prp. (+acc) gathering, collecting, or plucking [ava + √ci] ✗
ocināti

pr. (+acc) plucks; picks; collects [ava + √ci + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning plucks; picks; collects
Root Family ava √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction ava + cinā + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avaci
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

pāpasamācāro'ti mālāvacchaṃ ropeti'pi ropāpeti'pi, siñcati'pi siñcāpeti'pi, ocināti'pi ocināpeti'pi, gantheti'pi ganthāpeti'pi.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
ocināpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to pluck; makes pick; causes to collect [ava + √ci + nā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ocināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to pluck; makes pick; causes to collect
Root Family ava √ci
Root √ci･5 nā + *āpe (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā + āpe > cināpe (caus)
Construction ava + cināpe + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avaci
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

Example

pāpasamācāro'ti mālāvacchaṃ ropeti'pi ropāpeti'pi, siñcati'pi siñcāpeti'pi, ocināti'pi ocināpeti'pi, gantheti'pi ganthāpeti'pi.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
ocini

aor. (+acc) gathered, collected, or plucked [ava + √ci] ✗
ocinituṃ

inf. (+acc) to pluck; to pick; to collect [ava + √ci + nā + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of ocināti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to pluck; to pick; to collect
Root Family ava √ci
Root √ci･5 nā (gather, accumulate)
Base √ci + nā > cinā
Construction ava + cinā + ituṃ
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avacetum
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)
ocinitvā

abs. (+acc) having gathered, collected, or plucked [ava + √ci] ✗
ocīraka

adj. with bark hanging down; with flaking bark [ava + cīra + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from cīra
Meaning with bark hanging down; with flaking bark
Construction ava + cīra + ka
ocīra + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym ocīrakajāta
Commentary (SNa) sv'āssa phalitakāle diṭṭhattā attano dassan'ānurūpena ocirakajāto ādinnasipāṭiko'ti āha. phalitakālasmiñ'hi kiṃsuko olambamānacīrako viya adhomukhaṃ katvā gahitaasikoso viya ca sirīsarukkho viya ca lambamānaphalo hoti.
Sanskrit avacīra (bsk)

Example

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, ocīrakajāto kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko ādinnasipāṭiko, seyyathā'pi sirīso'ti. tena kho pana, bhikkhu, samayena t'ādiso'v'assa kiṃsuko, yathā'pi tassa purisassa dassanaṃ.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
ocīrakajāta

adj. with bark hanging down; with flaking bark [ocīraka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with bark hanging down; with flaking bark
Construction ocīraka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (ocīraka + jāta)
Synonym ocīraka
Commentary (SNa) sv'āssa phalitakāle diṭṭhattā attano dassan'ānurūpena ocirakajāto ādinnasipāṭiko'ti āha. phalitakālasmiñ'hi kiṃsuko olambamānacīrako viya adhomukhaṃ katvā gahitaasikoso viya ca sirīsarukkho viya ca lambamānaphalo hoti.
Sanskrit avacīra (bsk) + jāta

Example

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, ocīrakajāto kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko ādinnasipāṭiko, seyyathā'pi sirīso'ti. tena kho pana, bhikkhu, samayena t'ādiso'v'assa kiṃsuko, yathā'pi tassa purisassa dassanaṃ.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
ojaṭṭhamaka

adj. having nutritional essence as the eighth; i.e. the four elements, colour, odour, flavour and nutritive essence [oja + aṭṭhamaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having nutritional essence as the eighth; i.e. the four elements, colour, odour, flavour and nutritive essence
Construction oja + aṭṭhamaka
ojaṭṭhāyī

adj. resting on or supported by its vigor or vitality ✗
ojavanaka

adj. (of a ship) going downstream; sailing downstream [ava + √ju + *ana + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ojavana
Meaning (of a ship) going downstream; sailing downstream
Root Family ava √ju
Root √ju･1 a (be fast)
Construction ava + √ju > jav + *ana + ka
ojavana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ava > o
u > av
Antonym ujjavanaka
Synonym ojavanikā
Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana yo adho javanato ojavanikāya nāvāya kīḷati, so adhogāminiṃ abhiruhatī'ti vuccati. ten'assā'pi padabhājane attham'eva dassetuṃ ojavanikāyā'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit ava + javana
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)

Example

uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.

VIN 2.5.3.8 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ
ojavanikā

adj. (of a ship) going downstream; sailing downstream [ava + √ju + *ana + ka + ikā] ✓

Meaning (of a ship) going downstream; sailing downstream
Root Family ava √ju
Root √ju･1 a (be fast)
Construction ava + √ju > jav + *ana + ka + ikā
ojavanaka + ikā
Phonetic Change ava > o
u > av
Antonym ujjavanikā
Synonym ojavanaka
Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana yo adho javanato ojavanikāya nāvāya kīḷati, so adhogāminiṃ abhiruhatī'ti vuccati. ten'assā'pi padabhājane attham'eva dassetuṃ ojavanikāyā'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit ava + javanikā
Sanskrit Root √jū 1, 9 (be swift)

Example

uddhaṃgāminin'ti ujjavanikāya. adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.

VIN 2.5.3.8 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ
ojavanī

fem. (of a ship) going downstream; sailing downstream [ava + √ju] ✗
ojavant 1

adj. nutritious; nourishing; juicy; lit. having nutrient quality [ojas + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from ojas
Meaning nutritious; nourishing; juicy; lit. having nutrient quality
Construction ojas + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Sanskrit ojasvat (powerful)

Examples

tasmiṃ samaye catusattatisahassajaṭilā paṇītapaṇītāni ojavantāni phal'āphalāni gahetvā ācariyassa santikaṃ sampattā buddhānañ'c'eva ācariyassa ca nisinnāsanaṃ oloketvā āhaṃsu.

ANa 1.14.1 sāriputta-moggallānatthera vatthu

saddhassa, bhikkhave, sāvakassa satthusāsane pariyogāya vattato rumhaniyaṃ satthusāsanaṃ hoti ojavantaṃ.

MN 70 kīṭāgirisuttaṃ
ojavant 2

adj. vigorous, strong [ojas] ✗
ojas

masc. nutrient; essence; sap ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning nutrient; essence; sap
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit ojas

Example

ahañ'c'eva kho pana sabbaso ajaddhukaṃ paṭijāneyyaṃ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṃ ojaṃ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṃ, tāya c'āhaṃ yāpeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā'ti.

ojasi

masc. name of a deity [ojas + i] ~

Grammar masc, from ojas
Meaning name of a deity
Construction ojas + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
ojaharaṇa

adj. sap stealing; nutrition robbing [ojas + haraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sap stealing; nutrition robbing
Construction ojas + haraṇa
Variant ojaharaṇī, ojāpaharaṇa
ojaharaṇī

adj. sap stealing; nutrition robbing [ojas + haraṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sap stealing; nutrition robbing
Construction ojas + haraṇī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ojaṃ + haraṇī)
Variant ojaharaṇa, ojāpaharaṇa
Sanskrit ojas + apaharaṇa

Example

so yā tā sālalaṭṭhiyo kuṭilā ojaharaṇiyo tā chetvā bahiddhā nīhareyya, antovanaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodheyya. yā pana tā sālalaṭṭhiyo ujukā sujātā tā sammā parihareyya.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
ojā

fem. nutritive essence, juice, sap ✗
ojāpaharaṇa

adj. sap stealing; nutrition robbing [ojas + apaharaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sap stealing; nutrition robbing
Construction ojas + apaharaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ojaṃ + apaharaṇa)
Variant ojaharaṇa, ojaharaṇī
Sanskrit ojas + apaharaṇa

Example

so yā tā sālalaṭṭhiyo kuṭilā oj'āpaharaṇiyo tā chetvā bahiddhā nīhareyya, antovanaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodheyya. yā pana tā sālalaṭṭhiyo ujukā sujātā tā sammā parihareyya.

ojoharaṇa

nt. removing of bodily vitality ✗
oñāta

adj. despised; underrated ✗

oṭṭita

oṭṭha 1

masc. lip; lips ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning lip; lips

Examples

na oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 54 oṭṭhanillehakasikkhāpadaṃ

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
oṭṭha 2

masc. camel ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning camel
Sanskrit uṣṭra, auṣṭra

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
oṭṭhagoṇagadrabha

masc. camel, ox and donkey [oṭṭha + goṇa + gadrabha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning camel, ox and donkey
Construction oṭṭha + goṇa + gadrabha
oṭṭhagoṇagadrabhādivasena

ind. as a camel, ox and donkey, etc. [oṭṭhagoṇagadrabhādi + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning as a camel, ox and donkey, etc.
Construction oṭṭhagoṇagadrabhādi + vasena
oṭṭhaja

adj. (gram) labial; lit. born from the lips [oṭṭha + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) labial; lit. born from the lips
Construction oṭṭha + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (oṭṭhehi + ja)
Sanskrit oṣṭhaja

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
oṭṭhaddha

masc. name of a Licchavi ✗
oṭṭhaddhalicchavīvatthu

nt. the story of Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi ✗
oṭṭhanillehakasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 54; lit. rule about licking the lips [oṭṭhanillehaka + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 54; lit. rule about licking the lips
Construction oṭṭhanillehaka + sikkhāpada
oṭṭhanillehakaṃ

ind. licking the lips [oṭṭha + nillehaka + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of oṭṭhanillehaka
Meaning licking the lips
Construction oṭṭha + nillehaka + aṃ
oṭṭhanillehaka + aṃ
Commentary (VINa) pattanillehaka oṭṭhanillehakesu'pi es'eva nayo. tasmā ek'aṅguliyā'pi patto na nillehitabbo, ekaoṭṭho'pi jivhāya na nillehitabbo, oṭṭhamaṃsehi eva pana gahetvā anto pavesetuṃ vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit oṣṭha + avalehaka

Examples

na oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 54 oṭṭhanillehakasikkhāpadaṃ

na oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo
oṭṭhapada

nt. camel's hoof; camel's foot [oṭṭha + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning camel's hoof; camel's foot
Construction oṭṭha + pada
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (oṭṭhassa + pada)
Commentary (MNa) oṭṭhapadan'ti yathā oṭṭhassa padaṃ majjhe gambhīraṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ bodhisattassa milāte maṃsalohite vaccadvārassa antopaviṭṭhattā ānisadaṃ majjhe gambhīraṃ hoti. athassa bhūmiyaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānaṃ sarapoṅkhena akkantaṃ viya majjhe unnataṃ hoti.
Sanskrit uṣṭra + pada

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
oṭṭhapahatamatta

nt. mere oral recitation; mere verbal repetition; lit. lip smacking measure [oṭṭha + pahata + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mere oral recitation; mere verbal repetition; lit. lip smacking measure
Construction oṭṭha + pahata + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (oṭṭhapahata + matta)
Commentary (MNa) oṭṭhapahatamattenā'ti tena vuttassa paṭiggahaṇ'atthaṃ oṭṭhapaharaṇamattena, apar'āparaṃ katvā oṭṭhasañcaraṇamattakenā'ti attho.
Sanskrit oṣṭha + prahata + mātra

Example

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tāvataken'eva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañ'ca vadāmi theravādañ'ca, jānāmi passāmī'ti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañ'c'eva aññe ca.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
oṭṭharoga

masc. disease of the lips [oṭṭha + roga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning disease of the lips
Construction oṭṭha + roga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (oṭṭhasmiṃ + roga)
Sanskrit oṣṭharoga

Example

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkhurogo sotarogo ghānarogo jivhārogo kāyarogo sīsarogo kaṇṇarogo mukharogo dantarogo oṭṭharogo kāso sāso pināso ḍāho jaro kucchirogo mucchā

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
oṭṭhavacittaka

masc. kind of bird (according to commentary named from its song) ✗
oṭṭhubhati

pr. (+acc) spits (on); expectorates (onto) [ava + √ṭhubh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning spits (on); expectorates (onto)
Root Family ava √ṭhubh
Root √ṭhubh･1 a (spit)
Base √ṭhubh + a > ṭhuba
Construction ava + ṭhuba + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (MNa) oṭṭhubhan'ti sarīre kheḷaṃ pātenti.
Sanskrit avaniṣṭhevati
Sanskrit Root √ṣṭhīv 1 (spew)

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, susāne seyyaṃ kappemi chav'aṭṭhikāni upadhāya. apissu maṃ, sāriputta, gāmaṇḍalā upasaṅkamitvā oṭṭhubhanti'pi, omuttenti'pi, paṃsukena'pi okiranti, kaṇṇasotesu'pi salākaṃ pavesenti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

so tatra tatra vikhaṇeyya, tatra tatra vikireyya, tatra tatra oṭṭhubheyya, tatra tatra omutteyya, apathavī bhavasi, apathavī bhavasī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
oḍḍayati

pr. ties, strings up; lays out, fixes (a snare or noose or net); lays out, presents (as a trap, or to mislead) [ud + √ḍi] ✗
oḍḍi

aor. (+acc) lifted up; presented; lit. set a snare [ud + √ḍi + i] ~

Grammar aor of oḍḍati, trans (+acc)
Meaning lifted up; presented; lit. set a snare
Root Family ud √ḍi
Root √ḍi･1 a (trap)
Construction ud > od + √ḍi + i
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VINa) oḍḍī'ti abhimukhaṃ ṭhapesi.
Sanskrit oḍḍeti (bsk)
Sanskrit Root - - (-)
oḍḍita

pp. (of snare, net, trap) laid down; planted; set [ud + √ḍi + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of oḍḍeti
Meaning (of snare, net, trap) laid down; planted; set
Root Family ud √ḍi
Root √ḍi･1 a (trap)
Construction ud > od + √ḍi + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > o
Variant oṭṭita
Sanskrit oḍḍita (bsk)
Sanskrit Root - - (-)

Examples

piṇḍikāya paviṭṭho'haṃ,
gacchanto naṃ udikkhisaṃ,
alaṅ'kataṃ suvasanaṃ,
maccupāsaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā

sārattā kāmabhogesu,
giddhā kāmesu mucchitā,
atisāraṃ na bujjhanti,
migā kūṭaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ,
pacchā'saṃ kaṭukaṃ hoti,
vipāko hissa pāpako'ti.

SN 3.6 appakasuttaṃ
oḍḍeti

pr. (+acc) sets a trap (of); lays a snare (of) [ud + √ḍi + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sets a trap (of); lays a snare (of)
Root Family ud √ḍi
Root √ḍi･1 a (trap)
Base √ḍi + a > ḍe
Construction ud > od + ḍe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
i > e
Commentary (SNa) lepaṃ oḍḍentī'ti vaṭarukkhakhīr'ādīhi yojetvā lepaṃ karonti, taṃ makkaṭānaṃ dhuvagamanaṭṭhānan'ti sallakkhetvā rukkhasākh'ādīsu ṭhapenti.
Sanskrit oḍḍeti (bsk)
Sanskrit Root - - (-)

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, luddā makkaṭavīthīsu lepaṃ oḍḍenti makkaṭānaṃ bādhanāya.

otata

pr. is heated; becomes warm [ava + √tap] ✗
otaraṇa

nt. (+abl) descending (from); coming down (from) [ava + √tar + a + aṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, from otarati (+abl)
Meaning descending (from); coming down (from)

Sanskrit avataraṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
otarati 1

pr. (+acc) descends (into); goes down (into); flows down (into) [ava + √tar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning descends (into); goes down (into); flows down (into)
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction ava + tara + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym orohati
Sanskrit avatarati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca appamatto goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otareyya. tam'enaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

te tattha kāyaṃ vaḍḍhetvā balaṃ gāhetvā kusobbhe otaranti, kusobbhe otaritvā mahāsobbhe otaranti, mahāsobbhe otaritvā kunnadiyo otaranti.

SN 45.85 nāgasuttaṃ
otarati 2

pr. (+loc) fits (with); is found (in); cross-references (with); lit. crosses down [ava + √tar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning fits (with); is found (in); cross-references (with); lit. crosses down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction ava + tara + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Variant osarati
Commentary (ANa) na c'eva sutte otarantī'ti suttapaṭipāṭiyā katthaci anāgantvā challiṃ uṭṭhapetvā guḷhavessantara-guḷhaummagga-guḷhavinayavedallapiṭakānaṃ aññatarato āgatāni paññāyantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit avatarati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na c'eva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭham'ettha gantabbaṃ, addhā, idaṃ na c'eva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa, imassa ca bhikkhuno duggahitan'ti.

AN 4.180 mahāpadesasuttaṃ
otaranta

prp. (+abl) descending (from); coming down (from) [ava + √tar + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of otarati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning descending (from); coming down (from)
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction ava + tara + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avatarat
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

so pana dhamm'āsanato otaranto dhammakathiko viya, nisseṇito otaranto puriso viya, ca dve ca hatthe dve ca pāde pasāretvā

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
otaramāna

prp. descending; coming down [ava + √tar] ✗
otari

aor. descended, went down to [ava + √tar] ✗
otarituṃ

inf. (+acc) to go down (to); to descend (into) [ava + √tar + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of otarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to go down (to); to descend (into)
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)

Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avataritum
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

evañ'hi so, bhante, kakkaṭako sabbehi aḷehi sañchinnehi sambhaggehi sampalibhaggehi abhabbo taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ puna otarituṃ, seyyathā'pi pubbe.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

te tattha kāyaṃ vaḍḍhetvā balaṃ gāhetvā kusobbhe otaranti, kusobbhe otaritvā mahāsobbhe otaranti, mahāsobbhe otaritvā kunnadiyo otaranti.

SN 45.85 nāgasuttaṃ
otallaka

adj. poor; wretched ✗
otāpayati

pr. warms; warms in the sun, dries; puts (in the sun) to dry [ava + √tap] ✗
otāpayamāna

prp. (+acc) warming; heating in the sun; lit. causing to heat down [ava + √tap + *aya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of otāpayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning warming; heating in the sun; lit. causing to heat down
Root Family ava √tap
Root √tap･1 *aya (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + *aya > tāpaya (caus)
Construction ava + tāpaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (SNa) piṭṭhiṃ otāpayamāno'ti yasmā sammāsambuddhassa'pi upādinnakasarīre uṇhakāle uṇhaṃ hoti, sītakāle sītaṃ, ayañ'ca himapātasītasamayo. tasmā mahācīvaraṃ otāretvā sūriyarasmīhi piṭṭhiṃ otāpayamāno nisīdi.
Sanskrit avatapayamāna
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
otāpita

pp. dried; sunned [ava + √tap] ✗
otāpeti

pr. dries; suns [ava + √tap] ✗

Meaning drying; sunning; drying in the sun
Root Family ava √tap

Construction ava + tāpe + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avatapayat
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
otāpesi

aor. dried; sunned [ava + √tap] ✗
otāra 1

masc. chance; opportunity; opening; gap; lit. crossing down [ava + √tar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from otarati
Meaning chance; opportunity; opening; gap; lit. crossing down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ava + √tar > tār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Synonym avakāsa, okāsa, vāra
Commentary (MNa) otāran'ti vivaraṃ chiddaṃ.
Sanskrit avatāra
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

kaliṅgar'ūpadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, labhati tassa māro otāraṃ, labhati tassa māro ārammaṇaṃ.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
otāra 2

masc. fault; shortcoming; imperfection; lit. crossing down [ava + √tar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from otarati
Meaning fault; shortcoming; imperfection; lit. crossing down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ava + √tar > tār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Sanskrit avatara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

satta vassāni bhagavantaṃ,
anubandhiṃ padāpadaṃ,
otāraṃ n'ādhigacchissaṃ,
sambuddhassa satīmato.

SNP 28 padhānasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 2
otāra 3

masc. point of entry; space to go in [ava + √tar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from otarati
Meaning point of entry; space to go in
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ava + √tar > tār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) labhetha otāran'ti labheyya pavesanaṃ, vinivijjhitvā yāva pariyosānā gaccheyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit avatara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje labhetha otāran'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
otāragavesī

adj. seeking an opportunity ✗
otāraṇa

nt. lowering down [ava + √tar] ✗
otārayati

pr. causes to descend, makes go down (into), fetches down; lets down, lowers, puts down; takes down, removes; makes appear, puts forward; makes alight [ava + √tar] ✗
otāraṃ labhati

idiom. gets a chance; finds an opportunity; gains entry ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning gets a chance; finds an opportunity; gains entry
Sanskrit avatāram + labhati

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso lahukaṃ suttaguḷaṃ sabbasāramaye aggaḷaphalake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso taṃ lahukaṃ suttaguḷaṃ sabbasāramaye aggaḷaphalake labhetha otāran'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi māro pāpimā satataṃ samitaṃ paccupaṭṭhito, app'eva nām'āhaṃ imesaṃ cakkhuto vā otāraṃ labheyyaṃ

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
otārāpekka

adj. watching for a chance ✗
otārāpekkha

adj. looking for an opening; longing for a weak point ✗
otārāpetvā

abs. having brought down; having lowered [ava + √tar] ✗
otārita

pp. lowered into; brought down [ava + √tar + *e + ita] ~

Grammar pp of otāreti, caus
Meaning lowered into; brought down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction ava + tāre + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avatrita
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
otāritamatta

adj. merely lowered [otārita + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning merely lowered
Construction otārita + matta
otāriyamāna

prp. (+loc) being checked (in); being gone into (in); being cross-referenced (in); lit. being made to cross down [ava + √tar + *e + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of otāriyati, caus, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning being checked (in); being gone into (in); being cross-referenced (in); lit. being made to cross down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 *e + iya (cross)
Base √tar + *e + iya > tāriya (caus, pass)
Construction ava + tāriya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Variant osāriyamāna
Sanskrit avataryamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na c'eva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭham'ettha gantabbaṃ, addhā, idaṃ na c'eva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa, imassa ca bhikkhuno duggahitan'ti.

AN 4.180 mahāpadesasuttaṃ
otāretabba

ptp. (+loc) should be checked (in); should be gone into (in); should be cross-referenced; lit. to cause to be crossed down [ava + √tar + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of otāreti, caus (+loc)
Meaning should be checked (in); should be gone into (in); should be cross-referenced; lit. to cause to be crossed down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction ava + tāre + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Variant osāretabba
Sanskrit avatṝ
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ. anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.

Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)

Example

JAa 21 kuruṅgamigajātakavaṇṇanā
otārenta 2

prp. (+acc) (of talk) introducing; bringing in; descending (into); diving (into); lit. causing to cross down [ava + √tar + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of otāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of talk) introducing; bringing in; descending (into); diving (into); lit. causing to cross down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction ava + tāre + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Sanskrit avatārayat
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmetī'ti āgantukakathaṃ otārento purimakathaṃ bahiddhā apanāmeti. tatr'idaṃ vatthu, bhikkhū kira sannipatitvā ekaṃ daharaṃ, āvuso, tvaṃ imañ'c'imañ'ca āpattiṃ āpanno'ti āhaṃsu. so āha, bhante, nāgadīpaṃ gato'mhī'ti.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
otārenta 3

prp. (+acc) lowering [ava + √tar] ✗
otāresi

aor. brought or lowered down [ava + √tar] ✗
otiṇṇa 1

pp. (+instr) afflicted (with); affected (by); victim (of); immersed (in); lit. crossed down [ava + √tar + na] ✓

Grammar pp of otarati (+instr)
Meaning afflicted (with); affected (by); victim (of); immersed (in); lit. crossed down
Root Family ava √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction ava + √tar > tir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > i (Kacc 581, 616)
rn > ṇṇ
Synonym avatiṇṇa, āhata
Sanskrit avatīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

yena sallena otiṇṇo,
disā sabbā vidhāvati,
tam'eva sallam'abbuyha,
na dhāvati na sīdati.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
otomasika

adj. (one) who is in the dark ✗
otta

nt. (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel; lit. o state [o + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, letter, abstr, from o
Meaning (gram) letter o; 8th letter of the alphabet; guttural-labial vowel; lit. o state
Construction o + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym okāra
Sanskrit o

Example

vaca'icc'etassa dhātussa akāro ottam'āpajjate ajjatanimhi vibhattimhi. avoca. avocuṃ. ajjatanimhī'ti kim'atthaṃ? avaca, avacū.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 477
ottapa

masc. fear (of); being wary (of) [ud + √tapp + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from ottapati
Meaning fear (of); being wary (of)
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Construction ud > od + √tapp > tap + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)
ottapati

pr. feels ashamed or bashful; is afraid (of doing wrong); is scrupulous (to avoid, with instrumental, genitive, and, rarely, accusative); (also ottappati) [ud + √tapp] ✗
ottappa

nt. regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others [ud + √tapp + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from ottappati
Meaning regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Construction ud > od + √tapp + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ottappiya
Commentary (DHPa) api c'ettha ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā hirī, bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ.
Notes CPD suggests apa + √trap + a + ya
Sanskrit apatrapā, otrapa (bsk), apatrāpya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Examples

dve'me, bhikkhave, dhammā sukkā lokaṃ pālenti. katame dve? hirī ca ottappañ'ca.

AN 2.9 cariyasuttaṃ

ahirikassa purisapuggalassa hirī hoti parikkamanāya, anottāpissa purisapuggalassa ottappaṃ hoti parikkamanāya, appassutassa purisapuggalassa bāhusaccaṃ hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
ottappagāravatā

fem. fact of having respect for shame in wrongdoing [ottappa + gāravatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having respect for shame in wrongdoing
Construction ottappa + gāravatā
ottappati 1

pr. (+instr) regrets; feels remorse (about) [ud + √tapp + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning regrets; feels remorse (about)
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Base √tapp + a > tappa
Construction ud > od + tappa + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit apatrapati
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, ottappati pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ottappadhanaṃ.

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi rañño paccantime nagare anupariyāyapatho hoti ucco c'eva vitthato ca, evam'evaṃ kho, ariyasāvako ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
ottappati 2

pr. (+instr) feels embarrassed (by); is afraid of wrongdoing [ud + √tapp + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning feels embarrassed (by); is afraid of wrongdoing
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Base √tapp + a > tappa
Construction ud > od + tappa + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit apatrapati
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma suṇisā sasuraṃ disvā ottappati hirīyati, evam'eva sakkassa devānam'indassa paricārikāyo āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ disvā ottappamānā hirīyamānā sakaṃ sakaṃ ovarakaṃ pavisiṃsu.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
ottappadhana

nt. wealth of shame in wrongdoing [ottappa + dhana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wealth of shame in wrongdoing
Construction ottappa + dhana
ottappapariyāyapatha

adj. with sense of shame in wrongdoing as one's encircling path [ottappa + pariyāyapatha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with sense of shame in wrongdoing as one's encircling path
Construction ottappa + pariyāyapatha
Compound kammadhāraya (ottappa viya pariyāyapatha)
Sanskrit apatrapā, otrapa (bsk), apatrāpya (bsk) + paryāya + patha

Example

ottappapariyāyapatho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. iminā tatiyena saddhammena samannāgato hoti.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
ottappabala

nt. powerful sense of remorse; strength of shame in wrongdoing [ottappa + bala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning powerful sense of remorse; strength of shame in wrongdoing
Construction ottappa + bala
ottappamāna

prp. (+instr) feeling embarrassed (by) [ud + √tapp + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ottappati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning feeling embarrassed (by)
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Base √tapp + a > tappa
Construction ud > od + tappa + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit apatrapamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Example

addasaṃsu kho sakkassa devānam'indassa paricārikāyo āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ, disvā ottappamānā hirīyamānā sakaṃ sakaṃ ovarakaṃ pavisiṃsu.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
ottappasampanna

adj. with a sense of shame in wrongdoing; with a sense of remorse [ottappa + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a sense of shame in wrongdoing; with a sense of remorse
Construction ottappa + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ottappena + sampanna)
Commentary (JAa) tattha hiriottappasampannā'ti hiriyā ca ottappena ca samannāgatā. tesu kāyaduccarit'ādīhi hiriyatī'ti hirī, lajjāy'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tehi'y'eva ottappatī'ti ottappaṃ, pāpato ubbegass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tattha ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā hirī, bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ.
Sanskrit apatrapā, otrapa (bsk), apatrāpya (bsk) + sampanna

Example

hiri ottappasampanno,
sappatisso sagāravo,
abhabbo parihānāya,
nibbānasseva santike'ti.

AN 7.33 hirīgāravasuttaṃ
ottappi

aor. felt a sense of guilt, was afraid of evil [ud + √tapp] ✗
ottappiya

nt. regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others [ud + √tapp + *iya] ✓

Grammar nt, from ottappati
Meaning regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others
Root Family ud √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Construction ud > od + √tapp + *iya
Derivative kita (*iya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ottappa
Notes CPD suggests apa + √trap + a + ya
Sanskrit apatrapā, otrapa (bsk), apatrāpya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Examples

saddhābalaṃ vīriyañ'ca,
hirī ottappiyaṃ balaṃ,
satibalaṃ samādhi ca,
paññā ve sattamaṃ balaṃ,
etehi balavā bhikkhu,
sukhaṃ jīvati paṇḍito.

AN 7.3 saṃkhittabalasuttaṃ

saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ,
hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ,
sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca,
paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.

d > t

Examples

saddho hi, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, sīlavā, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, hirīmā, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako, ottappī, bhikkhave, hatthako āḷavako

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, ottappati pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ottappadhanaṃ.

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ
ottāpa

Phonetic Change u > o
app > āp

Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Examples

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

caram'pi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahit'atto'ti vuccati.

ITI 111 sampannasīlasuttaṃ
otthaṭa 1

pp. (+instr) covered (by); spread over (by); lit. spread down [ava + √thar + ta] ~

Grammar pp of ottharati (+instr)
Meaning covered (by); spread over (by); lit. spread down
Root Family ava √thar
Root √thar･1 a (spread, expand)
√ In Comps tthar
Construction ava + √thar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
rt > ṭ
Synonym ottharita
Variant otthata
Sanskrit avastarta
Sanskrit Root √stṛ √stṝ 5, 9 (spread)

rt > ṭ

otthata

pp. covered; spread over [ava + √thar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of avatharati
Meaning covered; spread over
Root Family ava √thar
Root √thar･1 a (spread, expand)
√ In Comps tthar

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
rt > t
Synonym ottharita
Variant otthaṭa
Sanskrit avastīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √stṛ √stṝ 5, 9 (spread)

Example

yassa accantadussīlyaṃ,
māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ,
yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

DHP 162 attavaggo
ottharaka

nt. kind of sieve or filter (?) ✗
ottharaṇa

nt. spreading over, submergence [ava + √thar] ✗
ottharati

pr. (+acc) covers (with); spreads over (with); scatters (over) [ava + √thar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning covers (with); spreads over (with); scatters (over)
Root Family ava √thar
Root √thar･1 a (spread, expand)
√ In Comps tthar
Base √thar + a > thara
Construction ava + thara + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avastṛṇāti
Sanskrit Root √stṛ √stṝ 5, 9 (spread)

Examples

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, appaharite kato haritaṃ ottharati, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, thale kato udakaṃ ottharati, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, khittacittassa, vedan'āṭṭassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

nt. kind of sieve or filter (?) ✗

ottharitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having spread over; having covered [ava + √thar + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ottharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having spread over; having covered
Root Family ava √thar
Root √thar･1 a (spread, expand)
√ In Comps tthar
Construction ava + √thar + itvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avastartvā
Sanskrit Root √stṛ √stṝ 5, 9 (spread)
ottharitvā 2

abs. (+acc) having hit; having fallen on top (of); lit. having covered [ava + √thar + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ottharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having hit; having fallen on top (of); lit. having covered
Root Family ava √thar
Root √thar･1 a (spread, expand)
√ In Comps tthar
Construction ava + √thar + itvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
Commentary (VINa) ottharitvā'ti akkamitvā. so kira tehi ākaḍḍhiyamāno patito.
Sanskrit avastartvā
Sanskrit Root √stṛ √stṝ 5, 9 (spread)
ottharitvā 3

abs. (+acc) having submerged [ava + √thar] ✗
otthariyamāna

prp. (+instr) being covered (by); being submerged (under) [ava + √thar] ✗
oda

nt. water [√ud + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud > od + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ambu, uda, udaka, oka, odaka, ka, jala, toya, daka, ninnaga, vāri, salila
Notes uda in comps
Sanskrit uda
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tap'od'ārāme. atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tap'odā ten'upasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
odaka 1

nt. water [√ud + *aka] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, from udaka
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud > od + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ambu, uda, oka, oda, ka, jala, toya, daka, ninnaga, vāri, salila
Variant udaka
Notes form of udaka found in compounds and verse
Sanskrit udaka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Examples

accayanti ahorattā,
jīvitaṃ uparujjhati,
āyu khīyati maccānaṃ,
kunnadīnaṃ'va odakaṃ.

TH 133 heraññakānittheragāthā

abalā naṃ balīyanti,
maddant'enaṃ parissayā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
nāvaṃ bhinnam'iv'odakaṃ.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
odaka 2

adj. from water; related to water; aquatic [√ud + aka + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from udaka
Meaning from water; related to water; aquatic
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud > od + aka + *a
udaka + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym anodaka
Sanskrit audaka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Example

kaddamo nāma odako vuccati.

VIN 2.5.6.8 dubbaṇṇakaraṇasikkhāpadaṃ
odakantika 1

adj. requiring a wash at the end; unclean; dirty; lit. with water at the end [udaka + anta + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning requiring a wash at the end; unclean; dirty; lit. with water at the end
Construction udaka > odaka + anta + *ika
udakanta + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VINa) udakaṃ assa ante suddhatthaṃ ādīyatī'ti udak'antaṃ, udak'antam'eva odak'antikaṃ, yaṃ taṃ odak'antikaṃ, so methunadhammo.
Sanskrit udaka + antaka

Example

methunadhammo nāma yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odak'antikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
odakantika 2

nt. shore-line; water-line; lit. near water [udaka + anta + *ika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning shore-line; water-line; lit. near water
Construction udaka > odaka + anta + *ika
udakanta + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (KPa) atthi gambhīrañ'c'eva odak'antikañ'ca jaṅgale bhūmibhāge yāva idāni udakaṃ āgamissatī'ti, tāva khato āvāṭo viya. taṃ sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ gambhīre odakantike'ti.
Sanskrit udakānta

Example

nidhiṃ nidheti puriso,
gambhīre odak'antike,
atthe kicce samuppanne,
atthāya me bhavissati.

KP 1.8 nidhikaṇḍasuttaṃ
odakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.65 (SN56.65) ✗

Meaning rice; boiled rice; food; lit. wetting

Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)

Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym kura, bhatta
Sanskrit odana
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

Examples

so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto na pattaṃ unnāmeti, na pattaṃ onāmeti, na pattaṃ sannāmeti, na pattaṃ vināmeti. so odanaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti n'ātithokaṃ n'ātibahuṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

odanakummāsa

masc. foodstuff; rice and porridge [odana + kummāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning foodstuff; rice and porridge
Construction odana + kummāsa
Compound dvanda (odana ca kummāsa ca)
Sanskrit odana + kulmāṣa

Examples

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo odanakummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

DN 2.24 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummāsa-upacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

Meaning accumulation of foodstuff; a heap of rice and porridge
Construction odana + kummāsa + upacaya
Variant odanakummāsūpacaya
odanakummāsūpacaya

masc. accumulation of foodstuff; a heap of rice and porridge [odana + kummāsa + upacaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning accumulation of foodstuff; a heap of rice and porridge
Construction odana + kummāsa + upacaya

Variant odanakummāsupacaya
Commentary (SNa) odanakummāsūpacayassā'ti odanena ceva kummāsena ca upacitassa vaḍḍhitassa.
Sanskrit odana + kulmāṣa + upacaya

Examples

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo odanakummās'ūpacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,

Sanskrit avadāta + nidarśana

Example

ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni. seyyathā'pi nāma osadhitārakā odātā odātavaṇṇā odātanidassanā odātanibhāsā

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
odātanibhāsa

adj. white in appearance; radiating white [odāta + nibhāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning white in appearance; radiating white
Construction odāta + nibhāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (odāta + nibhāsa)
Sanskrit lohitaka + nirbhāsa

Example

ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni. seyyathā'pi nāma osadhitārakā odātā odātavaṇṇā odātanidassanā odātanibhāsā

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
odātapariyesanaṃ

ind. looking for white (cloth); searching for white (cloth); on a quest for white (cloth) [odāta + pariyesanā + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of odātapariyesana
Meaning looking for white (cloth); searching for white (cloth); on a quest for white (cloth)
Construction odāta + pariyesanā + aṃ
odātapariyesanā + aṃ
Sanskrit avadāta + paryeṣaṇa

Example

so suṇeyya cakkhumato bhāsamānassa, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti! so odātapariyesanaṃ careyya.

Meaning with clean mind; with a pure heart; lit. white mind
Construction odāta + manasa

adj. white in colour; white-coloured [odāta + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
odātavattha 1

adj. wearing white clothes; clothed in white garments [odāta + vattha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing white clothes; clothed in white garments
Construction odāta + vattha
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (odāta + vattha)
Variant odātavatthavasana
Sanskrit avadāta + vastra

Example

idāni te, bhante, taṃ rajojallaṃ pavāhetvā sunhātā suvilittā kappitakesamassū odātavatthā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāressantī'ti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
odātavattha 2

nt. white cloth; white garment [odāta + vattha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning white cloth; white garment
Construction odāta + vattha
Compound kammadhāraya (odāta + vattha)
Sanskrit avadāta + vastra
odātavatthavasana

adj. wearing white clothes; clothed in white garments [odāta + vattha + vasana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing white clothes; clothed in white garments
Construction odāta + vattha + vasana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (odātavatthaṃ + vasana)
Variant odātavattha
Sanskrit avadāta + vastra + vasana

Example

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'cā'pi so hoti sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu odātavatthavasano, atha kho so dubbaṇṇo'va hoti kodh'ābhibhūto.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
odātavasana

adj. wearing white; clothed in white [odāta + vasana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing white; clothed in white
Construction odāta + vasana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (odātaṃ + vasana)
Sanskrit avadāta + vasana

Examples

kacci'ttha, bhante, na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti? na h'ettha, āvuso, koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti. sādhu, bhante, yadettha na koci gihī ahosi odātavasano'ti.

AN 8.23 paṭhamahatthakasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena halidd'ābhijāti paññattā, gihī odātavasanā acelakasāvakā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
odātālaṅkāra

adj. adorned in white ✗

Meaning placed down; near at hand; placed ready

-ṃ (elision)

Example
