Meaning horse whip placed ready; lit. thrown down whip
Construction odhasta + patoda

Commentary (MNa) odhastapatodo'ti yathā rathaṃ abhiruhitvā ṭhitena sakkā hoti gaṇhituṃ, evaṃ ālambanaṃ nissāya tiriyato ṭhapitapatodo.

odhi

Meaning limit; boundary
Root Family ava √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ava + √dhā + i
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym anodhi
Synonym pariccheda
Sanskrit avadhi
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

das'ev'imā vassadasā,
maccānaṃ idha jīvitaṃ,
apattaññ'eva taṃ odhiṃ,
naḷo chinno'va sussati.

JA 498 cittasambhūtajātakaṃ

odhunāti

pr. (+acc) shakes down [ava + √dhū + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)

Root √dhū･5 nā (shake, smoke)

Construction ava + dhunā + ti

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā soṇḍikādhutto vālaṃ kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nipphoṭeyya evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nipphoṭessāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
odhuni

patvā nibbānasampadaṃ,
muccati sabbadukkhehi,
sā hoti sabbasampadā'ti.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
odhūta

pp. shaken off [ava + √dhū] ✗

pr. places (in); lays down; applies; directs, especially ~ati sotaṃ, gives ear attentively [ava + √dhā] ✗

taṃ me amoghaṃ savanaṃ,
vimutto'mhi anāsavo.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

ko nu hāso kim'ānando,
niccaṃ pajjalite sati,
andhakārena onaddhā,
padīpaṃ na gavesatha.

a > ā
Antonym unnāmeti
Commentary (MNa) na onāmetī'ti rukkhasākhāchedanadaṇḍ'aṅkusapādo viya na pacchato osakkāpeti.
Sanskrit avanāmayati
Sanskrit Root √nam 1 (bend, bow)

Examples

so gacchanto na satthiṃ unnāmeti, na satthiṃ onāmeti, na satthiṃ sannāmeti, na satthiṃ vināmeti. gacchato kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa adharakāyo'va iñjati, na ca kāyabalena gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so antaragharaṃ pavisanto na kāyaṃ unnāmeti, na kāyaṃ onāmeti, na kāyaṃ sannāmeti, na kāyaṃ vināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
onāha

Commentary (DNa) onītapattapāṇin'ti pattato onītapāṇiṃ, apanītahatthan'ti vuttaṃ hoti. onittapattapāṇin'ti'pi pāṭho.

Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

atha kho citto gahapati there bhikkhū paṇītena sappipāyāsena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi. atha kho therā bhikkhū bhuttāvino onītapattapāṇino uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu.

atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ aññataraṃ nīcaṃ āsanaṃ gahetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

opakkamika 1

adj. (of pain) self-inflected; self-induced; lit. related to going towards [upa + √kam + a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upakkama
Meaning (of pain) self-inflected; self-induced; lit. related to going towards
Root Family upa √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa > opa + √kam + a + *ika
upakkama + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) opakkamikā'ti upakkamanibbattā.
Sanskrit aupakramika (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

opakkamikā ce'pi te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti, abhabbā'va te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṃ ubbhaṭṭhakā honti āsanapaṭikkhittā, opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
opakkamika 2

adj. caused by violence; due to attack; (comm) due to external attack; lit. related to going towards [upa + √kam + a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upakkama
Meaning caused by violence; due to attack; (comm) due to external attack; lit. related to going towards
Root Family upa √kam
Root √kam･1 a (go)
√ In Comps kkam
Construction upa > opa + √kam + a + *ika
upakkama + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) opakkamikānī'ti ayaṃ coro vā pāradāriko vā'ti gahetvā jaṇṇukakapparamuggar'ādīhi nippothanaupakkamaṃ paccayaṃ katvā uppannāni. etaṃ bahi upakkamaṃ labhitvā koci vuttanayen'eva kusalaṃ karoti, koci akusalaṃ, koci adhivāsento nipajjati. (NIDD1a) opakkamikā'ti vadhabandhan'ādinā upakkamena jātā.
Sanskrit aupakramika (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √kram 1, 4 (stride)

Examples

pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ

iti imasmiṃ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyath'idaṃ ... pittasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā semhasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā vātasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utupariṇāmajā ābādhā visamaparihārajā ābādhā opakkamikā ābādhā kammavipākajā ābādhā sītaṃ uṇhaṃ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo'ti.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
opaṇa

masc. bargaining ✗
opaṇati

pr. bargains down [ava + √paṇ] ✗
opatitvā

abs. having flow down; fell down; fell on (to) [ava + √pat] ✗
opadhika

adj. connected with material acquisitions and attachment; (according to commentaries) forming a basis for rebirth ✗
opanayika

adj. pragmatic; applicable; relevant; lit. leading towards [upa + √nī + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upanaya
Meaning pragmatic; applicable; relevant; lit. leading towards
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa > opa + √nī > nay + *a + *ika
upanaya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
ī > ay
Variant opaneyyika
Sanskrit upaneya + ka
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Example

dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
opaneyyika

adj. applicable; relevant; practical; useful; lit. leading towards [upa + √nī + *eyya + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upaneyya
Meaning applicable; relevant; practical; useful; lit. leading towards
Root Family upa √nī
Root √nī･1 a (lead, carry)
Construction upa > opa + √nī > ne + *eyya + *ika
upaneyya + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Variant opanayika
Commentary (ANa) opaneyyiko'ti attano cittaṃ upanetabbo.
Sanskrit upaneya + ka
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

Examples

dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

so navañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, purāṇañ'ca kammaṃ phussa phussa byantīkaroti, sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
opapakkhī

adj. rejected, despised; or rejects, insults ✗
opapātika 1

adj. spontaneously reborn; spontaneously generated [upa + √pat + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from upapāta
Meaning spontaneously reborn; spontaneously generated
Root Family upa √pat
Root √pat･1 a (fall)
Construction upa > opa + √pat > pāt + *a + *ika
upapāta + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) vinā etehi kāraṇehi uppatitvā viya nibbattā abhinibbattā'ti opapātikā.
Notes PED suggests √pad
Sanskrit aupapāduka (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

Examples

sammādiṭṭhiko hoti aviparītadassano atthi dinnaṃ atthi yiṭṭhaṃ atthi hutaṃ atthi sukaṭadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko atthi ayaṃ loko atthi paro loko atthi mātā atthi pitā atthi sattā opapātikā

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

no ce āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti, ten'eva dhammarāgena tāya dhammanandiyā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.

Meaning spontaneously reborn being

a > ā

Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

Example

api ca kho opapātiko opapātikaṃ sāreti, sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, sarasi tvaṃ, mārisa, yattha mayaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarimhā'ti. so evam'āha, sarāmi, mārisa, sarāmi, mārisā'ti.

Sanskrit aupamya

Examples

opammaṃ karohī'ti. yathā, mahārāja, rañño bhaṇḍ'āgāriko bhaṇḍ'āgāraṃ pavisitvā nīlapītalohit'odātamañjiṭṭhāni rājabhogāni rūpāni passitvā sañjānāti. evaṃ kho, mahārāja, sañjānanalakkhaṇā saññā'ti.

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho

purimen'ev'āhaṃ, bhante, opammena bhagavato attamano abhiraddho. api c'āhaṃ imāni bhagavato vicitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni sotu'kāmo, ev'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paccanīkaṃ kātabbaṃ amaññissaṃ

Commentary (MNa) opasāyiko me bhavissasī'ti mayhaṃ samīpasayo bhavissasi, maṃ gacchantaṃ anugacchissasi, ṭhitaṃ upatiṭṭhissasi, nisinnaṃ upanisīdissasi, nipannaṃ upanipajjissasī'ti attho.

Example

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

Example

bālāvatāra sarasandhi
opāṭeti

pr. splits; tears apart [ava + √paṭ] ✗
opāta

masc. pitfall [ava + √pat] ✗
opātita

pp. made fall, interrupted [ava + √pat] ✗
opātetabba

ptp. will prompt; will interrupt [ava + √pat] ✗
opāteti

pr. (+acc) prompts; recites the first syllable together; (comm) together; lit. causes to fall down [ava + √pat + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of opatati, trans (+acc)
Meaning prompts; recites the first syllable together; (comm) together; lit. causes to fall down
Root Family ava √pat
Root √pat･1 *e (fall)
Base √pat + *e > pāte (caus)
Construction ava + pāte + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Commentary (VMVt) opātetī'ti saddhiṃ katheti.
Sanskrit avapātayati
Sanskrit Root √pat 1 (fly, fall)

Example

padaṃ nāma ekato paṭṭhapetvā ekato osāpenti. anupadaṃ nāma pāṭekkaṃ paṭṭhapetvā ekato osāpenti. anvakkharaṃ nāma, rūpaṃ aniccan'ti vuccamāno, run'ti opāteti. anubyañjanaṃ nāma rūpaṃ aniccan'ti vuccamāno, vedanā aniccā'ti saddaṃ nicchāreti.

Meaning immerses (in); washes (in); rinses (in)

Base √plu + āpe > plāpe > pilāpe (caus, irreg)

Sanskrit Root √plu 1 (float)

Examples

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

tena hi tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, taṃ pāyasaṃ appaharite vā chaḍḍehi appāṇake vā udake opilāpehī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

Root Family ava √pu

√ In Comps pu or phu

Example

vāt'ātape visosetvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya, masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā opuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
opuṇi

opunāti

pr. (+acc) sifts through; winnows; sieves; goes through finely [ava + √pu + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sifts through; winnows; sieves; goes through finely
Root Family ava √pu
Root √pu･5 nā (purify, cleanse)
√ In Comps pu or phu
Base √pu + nā > punā
Construction ava + punā + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Variant opuṇāti, ophunāti
Sanskrit niṣpunāti
Sanskrit Root √pū 1, 9 (cleanse)

Example

sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.

Sanskrit Root √pū 1, 9 (cleanse)

Example

pr. (+acc) sifts; winnows; sieves; lit. cleans down [ava + √pu + nā + ti] ✓

√ In Comps pu or phu

p > ph (Kacc 20, 27)

Sanskrit niṣpunāti
Sanskrit Root √pū 1, 9 (cleanse)

Example

so taṃ vīṇaṃ ... sakalikaṃ sakalikaṃ karitvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya. masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuneyya, nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.

obhagga 2

pp. looped [ava + √bhañj] ✗
obhaggavibhagga

adj. broken (or bent) and crushed ✗
obhaggobhagga

adj. bent and broken; lit. bent down bent down [obhagga + obhagga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bent and broken; lit. bent down bent down
Construction obhagga + obhagga
Compound dvanda (obhagga ca obhagga ca)
Commentary (VINa) obhaggobhaggan'ti tena hatthināgena uccaṭṭhānato bhañjitvā bhañjitvā pātitaṃ.
Sanskrit avabhagna + avabhagna

Example

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye āraññikassa nāgassa gocarapasutassa hatthī'pi hatthiniyo'pi hatthikalabhā'pi hatthicchāpā'pi obhagg'obhaggaṃ sākhābhaṅgaṃ khādanti, tena, bhikkhave, āraññiko nāgo aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati.

obhāsa 1.1

masc. light; radiance; aura; splendour [ava + √bhās + a] ✓

Examples

ayañ'hi dīp'obhāsaṃ vā aggi'obhāsaṃ vā adisvā maṇiāloken'eva bhuñjati ca nisīdati ca nipajjati ca, devo pana dīp'ālokena nisinno bhavissatī'ti?

obhāsakara

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning illuminator; radiant one; lit. radiance making
Construction obhāsa + kara

Sanskrit avabhāsa + kara

Example

evarūpā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū satthāro'ti'pi vuccanti, satthavāhā'ti'pi vuccanti, raṇañ'jahā'ti'pi vuccanti, tamonudā'ti'pi vuccanti, ālokakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, obhāsakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, pajjotakarā'ti'pi vuccanti, ukkādhārā'ti'pi vuccanti, pabhaṅ'karā'ti'pi vuccanti, ariyā'ti'pi vuccanti, cakkhumanto'ti'pi vuccantī'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca.

ITI 104 sīlasampannasuttaṃ
obhāsajāta

adj. radiant; beaming; effulgent [obhāsa + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning radiant; beaming; effulgent
Construction obhāsa + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (obhāsa + jāta)
Sanskrit avabhāsa + jāta

Example

obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ,
cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso,
t'ādisaṃ bhikbhikkhum'āsajjakhumāsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.

TH 25 nandiyattheragāthā
obhāsati 1.1

pr. (+acc) speaks coarsely (to); speaks suggestively (to); talks rudely (to); talks dirty (to); lit. talks down [ava + √bhās + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)

Base √bhās + a > bhāsa
Construction ava + bhāsa + ti

Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

Example

obhāsayamāna

duddiṭṭhī na dukkhā pamuccare'ti.

na ussesu vadate muni,
santo so vītamaccharo,
n'ādeti na nirassatī'ti.

namo omak'ātītassa tassa vatthuttayassa'pi. namokārappabhāvena vigacchantu upaddavā.

Root Family ava √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (rub, smear)
Construction ava + √makkh + i
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Variant opapakkhi, omakkhika
Commentary (ANa) omakkhiṃ karontī'ti ukkhittakaṃ karonti, ukkhipitvā chaḍḍenti.
Sanskrit ava + mṛkṣ
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Example

santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.

VIN PAT PC 2 omasavādasikkhāpadaṃ
omasati 1

pr. abuses; insults; hurts; lit. rubs down [ava + √mas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning abuses; insults; hurts; lit. rubs down
Root Family ava √mas
Root √mas･1 a (touch, rub)
Base √mas + a > masa
Construction ava + masa + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym paribhavati, paribhāsati, paribhoti
Commentary (VINa) omasantī'ti ovijjhanti.
Sanskrit avamṛśati
Sanskrit Root √mṛś 6 (touch, feel)

Example

omasavādo nāma dasahi ākārehi omasati, jātiyā'pi, nāmena'pi, gottena'pi, kammena'pi, sippena'pi, ābādhena'pi, liṅgena'pi, kilesena'pi, āpattiyā'pi, akkosena'pi.

VIN 2.5.1.2 omasavādasikkhāpadaṃ
omasati 2

Construction ava + masa + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avamṛśati
Sanskrit Root √mṛś 6 (touch, feel)

Example

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, aññesaṃ dento omasati, aññassa bhājane ākiranto omasati, uttaribhaṅge, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassāti.

aor. touched, handled [ava + √mas] ✗

Sanskrit Root √mṛś 6 (touch, feel)

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ omasitvā piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanti.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo

Sanskrit unmukta

Example

na pāduk'āruḷhassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā

Commentary (MNa) omuttenti passāvam'assa upari vissajjenti.
Sanskrit mūtrayati

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, susāne seyyaṃ kappemi chav'aṭṭhikāni upadhāya. apissu maṃ, sāriputta, gāmaṇḍalā upasaṅkamitvā oṭṭhubhanti'pi, omuttenti'pi, paṃsukena'pi okiranti, kaṇṇasotesu'pi salākaṃ pavesenti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

so tatra tatra vikhaṇeyya, tatra tatra vikireyya, tatra tatra oṭṭhubheyya, tatra tatra omutteyya, apathavī bhavasi, apathavī bhavasī'ti.

ora 1

adj. lower; inferior [ava + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, abbrev of avara

Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym uddha
Synonym oma
Sanskrit avara

Examples

dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, saṃyojanāni. katamāni dasa? pañc'oram'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni, pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ

na oramattakena vises'ādhigamena antarāvosānaṃ āpajjissanti

AN 7.24 dutiyasattakasuttaṃ
ora 2

nt. this side; this bank; near side [ava + ra] ✓

Grammar nt, abbrev of avara
Meaning this side; this bank; near side
Construction ava > o + ra
Derivative taddhita (ra)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym pāra
Sanskrit avara

Examples

oraṃ samuddassa atittarūpo,
pāraṃ samuddassa'pi patthayetha,
rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā,
avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti,
ūnāva hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ,
kāmehi lokamhi na hatthi titti.

MN 82 raṭṭhapālasuttaṃ

yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

uragavaggo 1

urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

corā ca vajjhaghātā ca,
ye c'aññe pāpakammino,
dak'ābhisecanā te'pi,
pāpakammā pamuccare.

u > o
h > p
Commentary (NIDD2) oropayitvā gihibyañjanānī'ti gihibyañjanāni oropayitvā samoropayitvā nikkhipitvā paṭipassambhayitvāti, oropayitvā gihibyañjanāni. (SNPa) tattha oropayitvā'ti apanetvā.

Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

sañchinnapatto yathā koviḷāro,
chetvāna vīro gihibandhanāni,
eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

SNP 3 khaggavisāṇasuttaṃ
oropita 1

pp. taken or lower down, laid aside [ava + √ruh] ✗
oropita 2

Grammar pp of oropeti, caus
Meaning (of hair) cut; shaved; lit. taken down
Root Family ava √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *e (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *e > rohe > rope (caus, irreg)
Construction ava + rope + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > o
h > p
Commentary (UDa) navoropitehi kesehī'ti aciraohāritehi kesehi, ittham'bhūtalakkhaṇe c'etaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit avaropita
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno kapotakandarāyaṃ viharanti. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto juṇhāya rattiyā nav'oropitehi kesehi abbhokāse nisinno hoti aññataraṃ samādhiṃ samāpajjitvā.

UD 34 yakkhapahārasuttaṃ
oropiya

ger. taking or lowering down, laying aside [ava + √ruh] ✗

h > p

Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udak'orohakassa udak'orohakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

amuko yo so puriso paṭhamaṃ rukkhaṃ ārūḷho sace so na khippam'eva oroheyya tassa so rukkho papatanto hatthaṃ vā bhañjeyya pādaṃ vā bhañjeyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ bhañjeyya

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno caṅkamā orohitvā vihāraṃ pavisitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ
olīnavilīna

adj. hanging or dripping down and round about ✗
olīnavuttika

adj. sluggish in practice; inactive in nature; doing as little as possible [olīna + vuttika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sluggish in practice; inactive in nature; doing as little as possible
Construction olīna + vuttika
Compound kammadhāraya (olīna + vuttika)
Antonym anolīnavuttika
Commentary (MNa) olīnavuttiko ca hotī'ti līnajjhāsayo hoti (SNa) gaṅgāya nadiyā tiriyaṃ patitvā, vālikāya otthaṭabhāvena antarasetu viya hutvā, bahūnaṃ paccayo jātarukkho viya rathavinīta-mahāariyavaṃsa-cand'opam'ādipaṭipadāsu aññataraṃ paṭipadaṃ uggahetvā ṭhito olīnavuttiko puggalo veditabbo.
Sanskrit avalīna + vṛttika

Example

lābhasakkārasilokena ca ye aññe dhammā uttaritarā ca paṇītatarā ca tesaṃ dhammānaṃ sacchikiriyāya na chandaṃ janeti, na vāyamati, olīnavuttiko ca hoti sāthaliko.

suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ. so saṅghaṃ kuṭivatthuolokanaṃ yācati.

Root Family ava √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ava + loke + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avalokayitavya
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Example

na ujjhānasaññinā paresaṃ patto oloketabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ oloketi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo
oloketi

pr. (+acc) looks (at); looks down (at); examines; checks [ava + √lok + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning looks (at); looks down (at); examines; checks
Root Family ava √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ava + loke + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym ulloketi
Synonym upaparikkhati
Commentary (MNa) naṭṭhaṃ kākaṇikaṃ vā māsakaṃ vā pariyesanto viya na adho oloketi
English Cognate look, looks, looking
Sanskrit avalokayati
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Examples

apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

na ujjhānasaññī paresaṃ pattaṃ olokessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 38 ujjhānasaññīsikkhāpadaṃ
oloketuṃ

inf. (+acc) to look at [ava + √lok] ✗
oloketvā

abs. (+acc) having looked; having observed; having noticed; having checked; lit. having looked down [ava + √lok + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of oloketi, trans (+acc)
Meaning having looked; having observed; having noticed; having checked; lit. having looked down
Root Family ava √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ava + loke + tvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
Sanskrit avalokya
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Examples

so gehā nikkhamitvā … akkhīni me dhūmāyantī'ti vatvā nalāṭe hatthaṃ ṭhapetvā uddhaṃ oloketvā, aho dukkhaṃ, ayyo no mahākassapatthero cirassaṃ me kuṭidvāraṃ āgato, atthi nu kho kiñci gehe'ti āha

DHPa 1.4.10 mahākassapatthera piṇḍapātadinna vatthu

tasmiṃ samaye catusattatisahassajaṭilā paṇītapaṇītāni ojavantāni phal'āphalāni gahetvā ācariyassa santikaṃ sampattā buddhānañ'c'eva ācariyassa ca nisinnāsanaṃ oloketvā āhaṃsu.

ANa 1.14.1 sāriputta-moggallānatthera vatthu
olokenta

prp. (+acc) looking (at); observing; checking; lit. looking down [ava + √lok + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of oloketi, trans (+acc)
Meaning looking (at); observing; checking; lit. looking down
Root Family ava √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ava + loke + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym olokayamāna
Sanskrit avalokayat
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

Examples

bodhisatto ito c'ito ca olokento kañci adisvā vegena uṭṭhāya pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ānāpāne pariggahetvā paṭhamajjhānaṃ nibbattesi.

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā

so gantvā taṃ bhattaṃ pañcahi paccekabuddhasatehi saddhiṃ saṃvibhaji. taṃ tass'ānubhāvena sabbesam'pi pahoti. te olokentā'y'eva aṭṭhaṃsu.

Examples

VIN 2.5.1.10 pathavīkhaṇanasikkhāpadaṃ

daḍḍhā'pi vuccati ajātā pathavī. yo'pi paṃsupuñjo vā mattikāpuñjo vā omakacātumāsaṃ ovaṭṭho, ayam'pi vuccati ajātā pathavī.

VIN 2.5.1.10 pathavīkhaṇanasikkhāpadaṃ
ovadati

pr. (+acc) advises; instructs; admonishes [ava + √vad + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning advises; instructs; admonishes
Root Family ava √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)
Base √vad + a > vada
Construction ava + vada + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym anusāsati, vadati, samanubhāsati

Sanskrit avavad (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

Examples

sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

atha kho, bhikkhave, pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū mayā evaṃ ovadiyamānā evaṃ anusāsiyamānā attanā jātidhammā samānā jātidhamme ādīnavaṃ viditvā ajātaṃ anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ nibbānaṃ pariyesamānā ajātaṃ anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ nibbānaṃ ajjhagamaṃsu

Meaning advisor; teacher; instructor; encourager
Root Family ava √vad
Root √vad･1 a (say, speak)

Derivative kita (*aka)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Synonym codaka

Sanskrit avavādaka
Sanskrit Root √vad 1 (speak)

Examples

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

evaṃ vadeyyā'ti upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhun'ovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo maṅkukattu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
ovādaka 2

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
ovādapāṭimokkha

Meaning Pātimokkha in the form of instruction
Construction ovāda + pāṭimokkha

Example

uddiṭṭhaṃ kho tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena: ovādapāṭimokkhaṃ tīhi gāthāhi.

Thai Traditional
ovādappaṭikara

adj. acting according to advice; following admonition; complying with instruction [ovāda + paṭikara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning acting according to advice; following admonition; complying with instruction
Construction ovāda + paṭikara
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ovādena + paṭikara)
Variant ovādapatikara
Commentary (ANa) ovādapaṭikarāyā'ti idaṃ vo kattabba, idaṃ na kattabban'ti dinnaovādakarāya.
Sanskrit avavāda + pratikara

Example

acchariyaṃ, bhikkhave, sāvakānaṃ! abbhutaṃ, bhikkhave, sāvakānaṃ! satthu ca nāma sāsanakarā bhavissanti ovādappaṭikarā, catunnañ'ca parisānaṃ piyā bhavissanti manāpā garubhāvanīyā ca!

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ
ovādavagga

masc. Section 3 of the monk's offences requiring confession; lit. section on instruction [ovāda + vagga] ~

Meaning Section 3 of the monk's offences requiring confession; lit. section on instruction
Construction ovāda + vagga
ovādasikkhāpada

nt. rule about instruction; Pācittiya 21 [ovāda + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about instruction; Pācittiya 21
Construction ovāda + sikkhāpada
ovādasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 16.6 (SN16.6) ✗
ovādasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.52 (AN8.52) ✗

Meaning encouragement and instruction; exhortation and teaching
Construction ovāda + anusāsanī

adj. who admonishes or exhorts [ava + √vad] ✗

Meaning approaching for the sake of instruction
Construction ovāda + upasaṅkamana
Commentary (ANa) ovād'ūpasaṅkamanan'ti ovād'atthāya upasaṅkamanaṃ.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about approaching for instruction
Construction ovādūpasaṅkamana + sikkhāpada
ovārenta

prp. (+acc) blocking; obstructing; concealing [ava + √var + *e + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ovāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning blocking; obstructing; concealing
Root Family ava √var
Root √var･1 *e (cover, dress, restrain)
Base √var + *e > vāre (caus)
Construction ava + vāre + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit avavarayat
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)
ovuṭa

pp. covered; encompassed; checked, obstructed [ava + √var] ✗
ovuṭṭha

pp. rained upon; exposed to the rain [ava + √vass] ✗
ovuta

pp. (+instr) closed off (by); shut off (by) [ava + √var + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ovarati (+instr)
Meaning closed off (by); shut off (by)
Root Family ava √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ava + √var > vur + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > u
rt > t
Sanskrit āvṛta
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

Example

ayaṃ loko kena āvuto nivuto ovuto, pihito paṭicchanno paṭikujjito'ti, kena'ssu nivuto loko?

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa

osa

Sanskrit avasa

Synonym ussajjati, parimoceti, moceti

Example

osadha

nt. medicine; drug; medicinal herb ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning medicine; drug; medicinal herb
Synonym agada, osadhi, bhesajja
Sanskrit auṣadha

Examples

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

sakkatvā dhammaratanaṃ, osadhaṃ uttamaṃ varaṃ, pariḷāh'ūpasamanaṃ. dhammatejena sotthinā nassant'upaddavā sabbe, bhayā vūpasamentu te.

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ osadhitārakā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ

Example

osaraka

nt. projection to a house or building, verandah ✗
osaraṇa 1

Grammar nt, from osarati

Construction ava + sāde + ti
Commentary (UDa) osādeyyā'ti pathaviyaṃ osīdāpeyya nimujjāpeyya. osāreyyā'tipi pāṭho, cuṇṇavicuṇṇaṃ kareyyā'ti attho.

Example

Example

osāne'tv'eva byāruddhe,
disvā me aratī ahu,
ath'ettha sallam'addakkhiṃ,
duddasaṃ hadayanissitaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 15
osāna 2

nt. end, conclusion, ceasing [ava + √sā] ✗
osāpayati

Example

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
osāpeti 1

pr. (+acc) concludes; completes; finishes; ends; lit. causes to complete [ava + √sā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ava √sā, trans (+acc)
Meaning concludes; completes; finishes; ends; lit. causes to complete
Root Family ava √sā
Root √sā･1 *āpe (complete, accomplish)
Base √sā + āpe > sāpe (caus)
Construction ava + sāpe + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Antonym paṭṭhapeti
Synonym uparundhati, nigameti, niṭṭhāpeti
Commentary (VIN) osāpentī'ti ... niṭṭhāpeti.
Sanskrit avasāyayati
Sanskrit Root √so 4 (destroy, kill, finish)

Example

padaṃ nāma ekato paṭṭhapetvā ekato osāpenti. anupadaṃ nāma pāṭekkaṃ paṭṭhapetvā ekato osāpenti. anvakkharaṃ nāma, rūpaṃ aniccan'ti vuccamāno, run'ti opāteti. anubyañjanaṃ nāma rūpaṃ aniccan'ti vuccamāno, vedanā aniccā'ti saddaṃ nicchāreti.

Example

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
osīdana

nt. slumping; collapsing; lit. sinking down [ava + √sad + a + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from osīdati
Meaning slumping; collapsing; lit. sinking down
Root Family ava √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + a > sada > sīda (irreg)
Construction ava + sīda + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ī
Sanskrit avasīdana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
osīdamāna

prp. sinking [ava + √sad] ✗
osīdāpana

nt. causing to sink, immersion [ava + √sad] ✗
osīdāpita

pp. caused to immersed, caused to sink [ava + √sad] ✗
osīdāpeti

osīdāpetvā

osīdi

osīditvā

abs. having drowned; having sunk [ava + √sad] ✗
osīdīpetvā

abs. having immersed, having caused to sink [ava + √sad] ✗
oseka

Meaning pouring; scooping; showering; lit. pouring down

i > e

Sanskrit avaseka

oseti

pr. deposits [ava + √si] ✗
ossajati

pr. lets loose, gives up, releases [ava + √saj] ✗
ossajana

nt. release, sending off [ava + √saj] ✗
ossaji

aor. let loose, gave up, released [ava + √saj] ✗
ossajja

ger. giving up or releasing [ava + √sajj] ✗
ossajjati

pr. (+acc) lets loose; sets free; releases [ava + √sajj + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning lets loose; sets free; releases
Root Family ava √sajj
Root √sajj･1 a (relinquish, let loose)
√ In Comps ssajj
Base √sajj + a > sajja
Construction ava + sajja + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym ussajjati, parimoceti, moceti
Variant osajjati
Sanskrit avasarjati
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

Example

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
ossajjana

ossaṭṭhakāya

adj. with one's form abandoned, abandoning one's body ✗
ossavana

nt. (of roof) eaves; overhang; drip fringe; lit. flowing down [ava + √su + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from avasavati
Meaning (of roof) eaves; overhang; drip fringe; lit. flowing down
Root Family ava √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction ava + √su > sav + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change ava > o
u > av
Sanskrit ava + sravaṇa
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse tālavaṇṭena'pi vidhūpanena'pi vātaṃ pariyesanti, ossavane'pi tiṇāni na icchanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
ossāvana

nt. (comm) the top of the roof [ava + √su] ✗
ohacca

ohana

ohanati 1

ohāya

ger. (+acc) leaving; giving up; abandoning [ava + √hā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ojahāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning leaving; giving up; abandoning
Root Family ava √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Construction ava + √hā + ya
Phonetic Change ava > o
Synonym paṭinissajja, pahāya, vihāya, vossajja
Sanskrit avahāya
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Example

ahañ'c'eva kho pana yādisake kāme ohāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito t'ādisake vā kāme pariyeseyyaṃ tato vā pāpiṭṭhatare, na m'etaṃ patirūpan'ti.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ
ohāraṇa 1

nt. removal [ava + √har] ✗
ohāraṇa 2

nt. shaving (of hair) [ava + √har] ✗
ohārapetvā

abs. having caused to be removed, having had removed [ava + √har] ✗
ohārayitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having shaved; having shaved off; lit. having caused to carry down [ava + √har + *aya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ohārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having shaved; having shaved off; lit. having caused to carry down
Root Family ava √har
Root √har･1 *aya (carry)
Base √har + *aya > hāraya (caus)
Construction ava + hāraya + itvā
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā
Synonym ohāretvā
Commentary (NIDD2) ohārayitvā gihibyañjanānī'ti gihibyañjanāni vuccanti kesā ca massū ca … dīghadasāni iti vā. ohārayitvā gihibyañjanānī'ti gihibyañjanāni oropayitvā samoropayitvā nikkhipitvā paṭippassambhitvā'ti, ohārayitvā gihibyañjanāni.
Sanskrit avahṛ, avahrayitvā
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

ohārayitvā gihibyañjanāni,
sañchannapatto yathā pārichatto,
kāsāyavattho abhinikkhamitvā,
eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

SNP 3 khaggavisāṇasuttaṃ

SNP 3 khaggavisāṇasuttaṃ
ohārita

ohārī 1

Meaning heavy; dragging down; weighing down; lit. carrying down
Root Family ava √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction ava + √har > hār + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change ava > o
a > ā

Sanskrit avahārin
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

etaṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñcaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna paribbajanti,
anapekkhino kāmasukhaṃ pahāya.

DHP 346 taṇhāvaggo

Meaning carrying down; transporting away

Example

SN 22.93 nadīsuttaṃ
ohāreti

pr. shaves; shaves off [ava + √har] ✗

DN 19.15 mahāgovindasuttaṃ

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan'ti.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
ohita 1

pp. put down; placed down; laid down [ava + √dhā + ita] ✓

Meaning put down; placed down; laid down

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

dhā > h
Synonym nihita
Sanskrit avahita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
ohita 2

pp. deposited; hidden; confined within; lit. placed down [ava + √dhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of odahati
Meaning deposited; hidden; confined within; lit. placed down
Root Family ava √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction ava + √dhā > (da)h + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ava > o
dhā > h
Sanskrit avahita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati n'ādhimuccati na sampasīdati, kos'ohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahūtajivhatāya ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.

DHP 150 jarāvaggo
ohita 3

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
ohitabhāra

adj. who has put down the burden; who has laid down the load; epithet of an arahant [ohita + bhāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has put down the burden; who has laid down the load; epithet of an arahant
Construction ohita + bhāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ohita + bhāraṃ)
Commentary (SNa) khandhabhāro kilesabhāro abhisaṅkhārabhāro kāmaguṇabhāro'ti, ime ohitā bhārā etesan'ti ohitabhārā.
Sanskrit avahita + bhāra

Examples

yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

khīṇ'āsavassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno vusitavato katakaraṇīyassa ohitabhārassa anuppattasadatthassa parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanassa samma'd'aññāvimuttassa ayam'anudhammo hoti veyyākaraṇāya

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
ohitasota

adj. listening attentively; with ears directed; lit. applied the ear [ohita + sota] ✓

Grammar adj, comp vb, pp of sotaṃ odahati
Meaning listening attentively; with ears directed; lit. applied the ear
Construction ohita + sota
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ohitaṃ + sota)
Antonym anohitasota
Commentary (MNa) ohitasoto'ti ṭhapitasoto.
Sanskrit avahita + śrotra

Examples

te ca bhikkhū aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasotā dhammaṃ suṇanti

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

kathāsampayogena, bhikkhave, puggalo veditabbo yadi vā saupaniso yadi vā anupaniso'ti. anohitasoto, bhikkhave, anupaniso hoti, ohitasoto saupaniso hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
ohiyitvā

abs. having stayed back; having remained behind [ava + √hā + iya + itvā] ~

Meaning having stayed back; having remained behind
Root Family ava √hā
Root √hā･1 iya (abandon)
Base √hā + iya > hiya (pass)
Construction ava + hiya + itvā
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Variant ohīyitvā
Sanskrit avahītvā
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)
ohiyyaka

adj. left behind [ava + √hā] ✗
ohiyyati

pr. stays behind; remains behind; lags back [ava + √hā + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of ojahāti, intrans
Meaning stays behind; remains behind; lags back
Root Family ava √hā
Root √hā･1 īya (abandon)
Base √hā + īya > hīya > hiyya (pass, irreg)
Construction ava + hiyya + ti
Phonetic Change ava > o
ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Variant ohīyati
Sanskrit avahīyate
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

Example

yattha ṭhito suṇāti, āpatti pācittiyassa. pacchato gacchanto turito gacchati sossāmī'ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. yattha ṭhito suṇāti, āpatti pācittiyassa. purato gacchanto ohiyyati sossāmī'ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
ohīna

ohīḷanā

fem. self-detesting [ava + √hīḷ] ✗
ohīḷitatta

nt. self-detestation [ava + √hīḷ] ✗
oḷāra

adj. vast; extensive; great; massive [ud + √ar + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from uḷāra
Meaning vast; extensive; great; massive
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > oḷ + √ar > ār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
d > ḷ
a > ā
Synonym uḷāra, bhūri, mahanta, mahā, vipula
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Example

ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi appamāṇo ca oḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamm'eva devānaṃ dev'ānubhāvaṃ.

SN 56.11 dhammacakkappavattanasuttaṃ
oḷārapāmojja

adj. experiencing great happiness (from); full of joy (in) [oḷāra + pāmojja] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing great happiness (from); full of joy (in)
Construction oḷāra + pāmojja
Variant uḷārapāmojja
oḷārika 1

adj. coarse; gross; substantial; physical; material [ud + √ar + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from uḷāra
Meaning coarse; gross; substantial; physical; material
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > oḷ + √ar > ār + *a + *ika
uḷāra + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym sukhuma
Synonym āmisa, kabaḷiṅkāra, kabaḷiṃkāra, kabaḷīkāra, kavaḷīkāra, thulla, thūla, rūpavant, rūpī
Sanskrit audārika
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
oḷārika 2

adj. (of food) solid; heavy; substantial [ud + √ar + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from uḷāra
Meaning (of food) solid; heavy; substantial
Root Family ud √ar
Root √ar･1 a (move, attain)
Construction ud > oḷ + √ar > ār + *a + *ika
uḷāra + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym sukhuma
Sanskrit audārika
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, na kho taṃ sukaraṃ sukhaṃ adhigantuṃ evaṃ adhimattakasimānaṃ pattakāyena, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāreyyaṃ odanakummāsan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya. katame cattāro? kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ
oḷigalla

nt. cesspool ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning cesspool
Synonym gūthaṭṭhāna
Commentary (ANa) oḷigallan'ti tesaṃ'y'eva kaddam'ādīnaṃ sandan'okāsaṃ. taṃ jaṇṇumattam'pi asucibharitaṃ hoti.
Non IA ōtukāl "water channel" (Tamil)
Sanskrit oḍigalla (bsk)

Examples

caṇḍaṃ kukkuraṃ parivajjeti, ahiṃ khāṇuṃ kaṇṭakaṭṭhānaṃ sobbhaṃ papātaṃ candanikaṃ oḷigallaṃ

MN 2.6 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

katamā ca, sāriputta, saṃsedajā yoni? ye kho te, sāriputta, sattā pūtimacche vā jāyanti pūtikuṇape vā pūtikummāse vā candanikāye vā oḷigalle vā jāyanti, ayaṃ vuccati, sāriputta, saṃsedajā yoni.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
